title: Great for dorm Rooms and more…
text:
This fits under my bed in the dorm room perfectly. I really like the reversible door. That is so handy for anytime I rearrange or my roommate wants to rearrange the room. Cans fit on the shelves and door easily. The little freeze compartment is nice for small things and even frozen candy bars. The control knob is simple to operate. Just turn to desire ‘numbered' temperature range. Very quiet. As you can see my head and pillow are right above it and I don't even hear it at night.

Trust you found this review honest and helpful:-)

title: Beautiful and functional desk
text: [[VIDEOID:dcee854a2f15508b1d2556d1aa2ea068]] What to like? Everything!  The drawers pull out smoothly and has a built in stopper.  The desk itself is a medium to heavy weight, it won't tip over or shake.  The top black wood looks really good.  It has solid metal legs too.  Assembly was easy, just bolt on the legs and screw on door knob handles.  Everything was packed safe and securely.

title: Quiet, Quick, and Simple to Use
text: [[VIDEOID:d032af288f50c7ecdceeca6913f87547]] Wow, very impressed at how simple this is to use.  Just plug it in, fill it up with water under the basket, and choose the size of your ice cubes.  And no maintenance required.  The are 2 sizes of ice cubes to choose from.  It really does make ice in minutes!!!  There is a drain plug at the bottom of the machine and you just pull it out to drain the machine if your going to leave it off for an extended time.  Very convenient!!!

title: Compact and Convenient Dishwasher
text:
This is an excellent compact dishwasher that is perfect for a small space. It is about the size of a large microwave. I found that it is light enough for one person to maneuver, but it's easier with two people. It has a good capacity for such a compact unit. It's easy to operate and comes with a power cord and connection hoses. It's likely that you'll have to purchase an additional adapter to fit your faucet.

The dishwasher looks nice and operates with minimal noise. The item comes securely packaged in Styrofoam to ensure it will arrive in good working order. This is a convenient and practical dishwasher for a small living space.

title: Very easy to setup and use! VERY heavy FYI
text:
I'm a decent sized guy and lift things around the house often but this things still about more than I can carry myself! I recommend using a dolly and then two people to hoist it up to where it's going. Then you need to run the drain hose to a sink drain or a big 5 gallon bucket would work (just make sure you have the hose secure or it could flop out and drain in the floor) Then you can hook this up to a sink or you can fill it's tank. I filled it's tank completely as I want to go that route and I loaded it up. Once the thing started running, I filled the tank all the way up again and it didn't have to be filled again for the whole wash cycle so it's pretty convenient. I think it'd be able to do everything on one full tank.

SO this is a smaller dishwasher and one level so you could fit one large pot and a couple cups maybe. But if you're doing little things- you can still fit a few things! It took it about an hour to run it's regular cycle and then it'd run it's fan for an hour drying it and pop open automatically when it's done. I just opened the door once it was done and let it all air dry though- no sense in having it dry things if you're not in a hurry.

Some things I love about this are: the UV light while drying (never seen that in a dishwasher!), it's very quiet- you could run it in an apartment at night without it being too loud, it cleans just as good as my full sized expensive $1100 dishwasher did! I had some dishes that hadn't been cleaned for a couple weeks because I was sick and I threw them in and they came out spotless! A couple pieces of silverware had a tiny bit of food residue but that happens with most dishwashers so no biggie- just sponge cleaned it off and rinsed it in seconds.

This thing would absolutely be great for an RV, tiny home, or just on the counter of a rental. On the rental- I'd check with the landlord first as some don't want you using a washer or dishwasher due to potential water leaks. But if it's allowed- get this thing, you will love it!! I truly never thought these mini dishwashers would clean so well but they do! Cleaning them is much easier than a full size too- it's super easy to pull the screen out and clean it!

No complaints or improvements that I can think of at all! It's heavy but it does the job so I'm fine with that!

title: Cleaning time saver!
text: Hosing these down is far easier than trying to scrub out my burners and oven, this is an absolute game changer for me! I used this for some of my holiday baking and got it good and messy and then pulled them all up to clean them and was VERY impressed with the ease of cleanup versus the old getting on my hands and knees to scrub out the oven! Very happy with these and wished I'd gotten them years ago!

title: Easy to use and makes ice quick!
text:
This makes ice pretty quickly and isn't that loud. I love the option to put a water bottle on top so you don't have to keep filling it. Even if you don't put a bottle on top though- it has a decent built-in water reservoir that you don't have to keep refilling it.

One tray of ice fills up pretty quickly and you dump it in the ice bag and it starts making more ice instantly after the tray is emptied. Very handy on a recent camping trip where we needed ice for drinks and snow cones! Highly recommend this machine!

title: Awesome mini fridge!
text: This mini fridge looks amazing with it's blue lights and everything. It seems to be of really good quality too. Plugged it in and had it cool in no time! I can fit a ton of cans in this and it keeps them very cold. No issues at all with this mini fridge. Came well packed and in perfect shape!

title: Great price, work great!
text: The price on these is great! I have a 4 burner stove so I like having a spare set to swap out with when the other needs cleaning. I throw it in the top rack of the dishwasher and it cleans them right up! Love how convenient these are!

title: Good quality machine. Makes ice in like 5 minutes!
text:
This makes the cutest little ice cubs, I think they're perfect if you are someone who eats ice. For an ice chest you'll probably be working at it for a while as this thing makes a handful of cubes every few minutes. The thing I love about this ice maker is it has a smaller profile than many of them I've seen. Many are much larger and bulkier. This one's not too bad at all. After using this thing a few times I can say that we love it! Seems to be well made and works perfectly.

The small ice and large ice are the exact same size, the large ice just stays on the metal rods longer so they become thicker. Both of them come out thin enough I can put them in my hand and just crush them completely. I honestly love this ice and am very happy with this!

To make Ice you just fill the bottom reservoir with water up to it's "Max" fill line which is marked "Max" and then it sucks water from that up to the top reservoir where the metal rods are cooled to the point that ice starts forming on them. Once the ice is ready it will drop the ice and the little motorized scoop will scoop it down into the little ice tray. Very easy to use and fun to watch!

title: Absolutely beautiful machine!
text:
LOVE this vent hood! Absolutely makes my stove look that much better- having this above it. It was pretty easy and straight forward to install and everything functions as it should. Seems to move a good amount of air which is nice!

Arrived in a large box and was very well packaged, had zero dents/ scratches! Overall I think this is amazing and the price point really isn't that bad for the quality you're receiving. Definitely a durable well made product from a trusted company.

title: Great Value
text: These are great. I change my filter once a month. I have purchased these filters several times and will continue.

title: Perfect for Rv'ers
text: Absolutely loved this unit perfect for the Rv and what a space saver

title: Piece of junk and customer service is worthless
text: Very noisy and the customer service for this unit is absolutely worthless. 4 emails and not a single useful response. Spend a couple of extra dollars and you can get a useful, reliable unit from a different company.

title: Works great!
text: This item arrived quickly, was easy to install and works well! We bought two in store for a lot more and both did not work so I am pleased with this purchase

title: Magnetic lint bin does a great job
text:
This works exactly as described and it perfect for collecting lint in from our lint trap. We just moved and our new house has the washer and dryer in the garage. I don't have a trash can out there and I don't want to sacrifice floor space, this little guy does the trick!

The magnet on it is huge so it holds on great to the side of our Samsung dryer. This would be great for holding things on anything metal (locker, busy board, fridge, etc). I could see getting a few more of these for different applications.

title: Sturdy reusable hot or cold cups
text: I ordered these for our picnic kit. They are sturdy plastic, textured on the outside and smooth on the inside, great for either iced or hot drinks. I ran them through the dishwasher and they were fine. They don't add any unwanted tastes to drinks. Just what I needed.

title: Make a Baked Potato or Corn on the Cob a Quick Snack
text:
If you live alone or with just one other person, this microwave accessory will be one of your favorite tools, especially in the summer when you want something hot without heating up the kitchen.

You just wash two potatoes, two ears of corn, or one of each in the cooker, snap it shut, and put the unit in the microwave. The directions (printed on the label) suggest three minutes. We live at almost 5000 feet and have an older microwave. When I checked after three minutes, the two medium-sized potatoes were still hard. I added another three minutes and they were perfect. Six minutes for baked potatoes in the middle of a hot summer afternoon was not bad.

This a new definition for fast food!

title: Customer service is a joke
text:
Great washer on the settings that work... If and when they do work.

This is my third washer from Amazon.
Needless to say not a single one works properly. By the time the third one came I couldn't even get customer service to listen to my problem.
The washer doesn't work on multiple cycles. The most used cycle 'normal' will not even rinse the clothes, bulky won't spin the clothes and heavy refuses to rinse as well. It came with multiple dents all three times I've received the washer. This one the third washer only has four dents in it whereas the rest we're so bad I wouldn't even keep them if they worked. But they didnt. Also why is there a 2-hour delay if I use cold water on the normal cycle... That's just crazy.
I even bought an extended warranty and for some reason I'm having trouble getting anybody to hear me out about my washing machine. If I spend over $300 on an item I expect it to work on all settings. Also this product would be way more maneuverable if I had multiple wheels on all four sides instead of just two in the back You almost have to tip the machine completely on its side to get it to roll. And the handles are so low on the machine I'm not sure exactly how they're supposed to be worked.
Super disappointed in Black & Decker also for not backing up your products.
So in conclusion if you would like a washer that works halfway this is the one for you! However if you would like your hard earned money to do what it's supposed to do look elsewhere!
I will be updating my review if anyone reaches out to me or I get the problem solved!

title: Works Great
text: I never really thought about cleaning my ice machine when I first got it but after having it for a few months I realized the sediments that can accumulate as I use the ice machine more and more. This cleaner and descaler have worked wonders for my ice machine. I didn't realize that my ice could take on a weird taste after a while and then I cleaned it and it really helped take that weird taste from my ice. It also helped with the leaking my ice machine was doing because of the scaling and buildup that I had no idea that was going on. This worked so well and I will continue using it from here on out. It was also super easy to use and just works.

title: Great Set but LOVE the filters!
text: I found these worked just as well as my other reusable k-cups and I love the filters so much. I don't find that it changes the taste of my coffee at all. The filters make it super easy to clean my reusable cups with just simply throwing out or composting the grounds and filter; rinse the k-cup and you're done. So much easier than using them without filters. As far as the price of this, well if you bought everything separately then it would be a little more expensive, however this is a one time purchase kit because I wouldn't want to have to buy more reusable kcups just to get the filters that I can get from someone else. Either way though, I am happy with this set and the kcups work great and hold up perfect for making coffee ahead of time to have when ready to use them. Great set.

title: Great for the Week
text: These are great and work just as they should. I love to fill them for the week so I don't have to waste so many other kcups. These are great and so far I've had no problems at all with these.

title: Makes Great Coffee
text: I love my coffee but I like to get the fresh ground too and this makes using my reusable kcups so much easier and cleaner. They pop right into my kcup and don't clog up my machine or anything. Makes great coffee with no funny tastes or anything. Makes cleaning up the kcup a breeze and no coffee grounds going all over the place. These are totally awesome and don't know why I didn't try these things before now.

title: Keeps Eggs Fresher Longer
text: I have to say that when I buy eggs I leave them in the carton that they come in thinking they are better in there so they stay fresher longer. However, after getting this egg tray I decided to try it out. What surprised me the most is the fact it kept my eggs so much fresher longer than keeping them in the container they came in. This egg tray seals and keeps the freshness inside. Also, with it being clear you can see just how many eggs you have left without having to open it back up. It holds a dozen of eggs no matter the size. This was one thing that honestly I had no idea I ever needed but am very glad that I have it now.

title: Love the Filters
text:
I really like coffee but I am a huge tea drinker and love to take tea with me when I am on the go but sometimes it can be a pain to brew up a cup of my loose leaf when I need to get going in the morning. Now that I have discovered this however, it has changed things for me. I can totally put in my loose leaf tea and brew it from my Keurig. I know there are a lot of different reusable K-cup things out on the market and while many of them are great (which I own quite a few) sometimes you want a little more filtration and that is where these comes in. The filters that come with these are great and really make for a nice cup of tea, without any of the fine residue that can come from loose leaf tea but it also makes for a great smooth cup of coffee too. Either way you go, you can't go wrong with these. I keep them in my tea box for whenever I want to make a quick cup of tea for the road and the cool part is that I have even reused the filters (for the same type of tea, of course) and they can work again and again for at least to help brew up two to four more cups, at least. They might not recommend doing that, but I like to get every cent out of something and I can even help the environment too by using these, love them.

Now the cups on the other hand aren't my favorite at all. It's just like a k-cup, thin plastic. The first time you use it the Keurig will make one hole on the top and one on the bottom of the cup and in order to use it again you can either pop it in and not worry about the other hole or line it up perfectly so that no other holes are made. Yeah, to much work for a cup of tea, for me. While they work just like a k-cup, I didn't reuse them like I did the filters. I actually used the filters in a reusable k-cup that I already had which, for me, worked much better than trying to use these plastic cups. I would totally buy this for the filters but not for the cups.

title: Works great!
text: This universal filter for use in Keurig coffee machines is great. It allows me to use my favorite coffee from a local roaster, without having to use K-cups. I also like that there is no plastic cup to add to the local dump. I had a little bit of an issue getting it to work at first. I actually called Keurig and a representative talked me through the process of removing one of the machine parts and replacing it with the sleeve that comes with the filter. That process could have been made a little bit more clear in the written instructions that came with the filters, but the representative was very patient and helped me all the way until I had it working properly. Yeah! It works great. I highly recommend getting the REAL Keurig filters and not one of the knock-offs out there. I've tried a few of those and couldn't get some of them to work properly. You may spend a little more on the real Keurigs, but I think it is worth it. They are made better and work properly with the machine.

title: Good, But I Wish It Had A Water Line

Overall, it's a lot of extra work and I rarely use it because of that.  I may end up buying a replacement that can be left connected.

title: Great Overall Ice Maker
text:
I've wanted a built-in ice maker for some time. There are 7 of us sharing the ice maker in a fridge and it just never cut it! I had two options in ice makers: nugget or cube. Nugget ice is much more fun, but it's not good for coolers. Cube ice works for both. So I got the cube maker. If I ever win the lottery, I'll get the other one too!

Anyway, the machine was a pain to install, but that's not its fault. First I hired someone because they had to move my fridge, tap a water line, and break through the wall to install the drain. They screwed all of that up and I ended up with a leak, a damaged fridge, and the drain line was leaking as well. They fixed two of the three a week later and now it works well (though the fridge is another story). The instructions were poor, that caused some of the problem (even the professional misread them). I mean, if you're selling a $500 product, can't you afford proper instructions with real pictures written by someone who speaks English?

All that aside, there is one thing I took off a star for: The unit doesn't stay frozen! It makes ice and dumps it in a fridge. It melts because that is a fridge not a freezer. And then it makes more ice. This causes a lot of wasted water and electricity, and it means that you absolutely must have that drain line installed!

I had another one of these some time back that cost a lot less and made about half as much ice a day. That one was insulated and stayed below 0, so the ice never melted! I didn't even connect the drain line and in 4 years of use, it never leaked. If I were to go back to the start of this project, I would have gotten that again. That's the reason I took off a star. The other style would have saved energy and cost $200 instead of $500... But overall, considering that I got the item at a discount here, I'm okay with this outcome.

title: Exactly Like The Original
text:
I haven't replaced this filter in years because of the expense of buying original ones. A few years back I found off-brand water filter replacements, but the air filter ones didn't seem to exist at the time. So I went ahead and bought this when I discovered it. I wish this had been around for years!

I can tell from looking at the two that they are made with the same charcoal inside, the material that air flows through is purposefully thin on both which allows me to see that they are the same inside. The fit is perfect, and it installed in seconds. I'm glad I now have a way to change this because it really does make the same difference that a box of baking soda makes, but without the occasional spills.

Now if only Roomba made a robot that walked around the fridge cleaning the shelves.........

title: Works well enough but doesn't really stay put.
text:
If you're searching for this, you know what it is. My gas range is the standard 36" range with built-in oven that is found in many homes. Nothing fancy. The problem is that there is a small gap between the range and the cabinet/countertop that food or liquid can fall into.

These Stainless Steel Stove Gap Covers solves exactly this problem. Due to its proximity to the fire and heat, the gap cover must be metal and because will be exposed to oils and other food particles, it needs to be easy-to-clean. These covers fit both criteria.

With an extendable piece, these covers can fit all ranges regardless of the depth of the stove and there is a small metal piece that is supposed to provide tension when inserted into the gap. Unfortunately, this is where I have the first problem with this product. The tension just isn't enough to keep the gap cover in the gap snugly. I think a cork or silicone piece would help give it the friction in needs to stay in place.

The second problem I have is that the product is in the shape of the letter "T" but because there is a slight difference in height between my range and the counter, it has to tilt to one side, further making it hard for the cover to stay in place.

The last issue is the extension part. It doesn't lock into a position. Without it, you can accidentally push on the cover and shorten it. It would be better to have some sort of locking mechanism that will keep it to the length that you set.

This product does what its intended for, but I think a few tweaks and it would be perfect (I might just look to see if I can make these tweaks myself).

title: For all those times we needed ice and nobody wanted to leave the party to get it.
text:
I've seen video reviews of products such as this BOSALY Ice Maker Machine. It promises to make ice in 9 minutes and I gotta say, it does just that. This ice maker can make two sizes of ice. In my testing, small ice cubes can be made in 9 minutes while the large one takes 11. I think it is necessary to set some expectations for this unit for those who are interested. If you know these things ahead of time, you will not be disappointed by your purchase:

This ice maker is fairly heavy, but that is to be expected because of the compressor. Also due to the compressor, this until will not work with power from a car adapter so as far as portability, you'd need to make sure there is a wall outlet or a generator that you can plug it into or you'll be draining a lot of battery power.

It must also be pointed out that the ice made by this machine is quite wet due to how the ice is made. It means that if you make ice with this machine, then put them into your freezer, you'll end up with one big lump of ice.

With that said, this machine does EXACTLY what I want it to do: make ice during a small gathering without the need for much oversight. Just make sure the water tank is filled.

Here are the features I like:
-- Portable. Be the savior of the party by bringing the ice maker for a friend's party.
-- Auto stop when the water level is low or the basket is filled.
-- Plug at the bottom allows draining of excess water.
-- FAST. 9 pieces of ice cube are made with each batch. That's enough for two cups.
-- Convenient. Make sure the machine is filled with water and plugged in. Come back once in a while to dump out the basket to make more ice or to refill the water.
-- Useful. This will definitely make a difference during a party. There are too many other things to worry about when preparing for guests.

Overall, great product.

title: Brilliant Solution to White Drip Tray Issue
text:
We have a black refrigerator and no matter how often I wipe the drip tray it always would have a white stain from where water had dripped at the bottom. This bugs some people while others don't even notice - unfortunately, I fall into the first category.

This set of 2 foam mats are cut to size then placed on top of your drip tray. While I measured and cut carefully mine still doesn't fit exactly but it is close. I might be among the only people who would notice.

This has proven to be an excellent solution to my white drip issue that has driven me crazy.

title: Decent Set of Simple Digital Thermometers Humidistats
text:
We recently moved to a new home in Florida. Prior to moving here I had decided to install a whole house dehumidifier. After installing it I wanted to be able to monitor the temperature and humidity levels throughout my house - I have done this using a few different methods, one of which is this set.

These simple small devices are easy to read and even easier to operate - just pull the tab and use.

My only complaint is 2 of the 10 in this set did not work out of the box. At this price it really is still reasonable for 8 units but not as great as for 10.

I have found these units work well, the batteries last a long time and the price is reasonable. While I wish all 10 of the units worked it still is a good set that I recommend.

title: Exactly What I Needed!
text:
This set of lower caster wheels was exactly what I needed for my Whirlpool dishwasher!

After moving into our new home we realized the lower rack of our dishwasher was missing a set of the caster wheels making the rack not glide as it should. After looking up the part needed I found it here.

This part fit exactly, snapped right into place and has worked flawlessly. Now the bottom rack glides in and out, even when completely filled, with ease.

This is an outstanding replacement part that you can count on.

Excellent product.

title: High Quality 10' Refrigerator Hose
text:
After nearly 15 years the previous hose connected to our refrigerator started to leak so rather than trying to figure out the source of the leak within the hose I replaced it.

This was a perfect replacement and could not have been easier to switch. I turned off the water, took the old one off and put this one on.

No more leak. This hose works perfectly as intended. Great product.

title: Years exp w/replacing  DO NOT BUY!! Melted plug n wires!!  read full review details
text:
It's been 9 weeks since I've bought this item and its total piece of JUNK! As stated below I've has to replace on a yearly basis since orginal went out. But 9 weeks this is an absolute RIP OFF. I'm so pissed right now because i will have to blow dry until a better one arrives. EVEN WORSE I find out the reason it stopped working isnt because it blew out. NO NO NO. its because it has melted the wire plug and the plug housing on the element itself. This could have ruined my life I couldve lost everything I've worked for. Thank God it didnt catch fire and ruin me and my family like.others have complained about. Very lucky it just melted the plugs and no fire.
This issues CAN NOT be blamed on my install or lack of knowledge either. I'm an exp. Electrician and I know what I'm doing and I know what I'm talking about. This is a cheaply made element and isnt worth saving money or time shipping to possibly loose everything.
I did buy a replacement again on amazon. Different seller and it's a different style.og element. The difference is the hood over top the element itself. They sell it for 4.95 and it is the same style I buy on line from a fridge company for 20$. No rather it last as long idk yet. But u you can read that review as well by clicking my name and viewing my older reviews. As always I will update and take serious my reviewing comments. Rank 4k and climbing for a reason. Good luck and be smart

Helpful hint do a google search for your element number and buy from someone other than amazon. These are not worth 2$ it's better to spend 20% and wait 5 days than this crap.. return window just closed 20 days ago which makes this even more of a sting.
DO NOT BUY I cant stress this enough DO NOT BUY

Works perfectly for my fridge.
I have seen alot of review talking about these not lasting very long. Heres my years of experience with this replacement element issues.
I bought my fridge used and really cheap because the people couldnt figure out how to fix it and thought it was trash.
Well the element was issue.
BUT
EVER since I replaced the element NO MATTER WHAT BRAND!! I have to replace once a year. Always in Aug because of the Alabama heat and humidity. My fridge runs really hard in summer months and ALWAYS blows out the element. So dont judge by those comments. I'm at year 5 now with the element issue and it isnt a brand thing i can promise you. It is just one of those things. This time around I replaced everything (included in this kit) let's see if that makes a difference. Idk though

The difference between all the others I've bought and this one is the guard over the element. The previous ones did not have the metal covering the top of element and that always made me wonder how it could last long with water dripping on a glowing red element. This one just may last a little longer because of that guard over the top only time will tell.

It seems well made, it is the right size thank God because the last time i bought, I could only find 8" ones but I got 2 for 22$. And even being 4" shorter they still lasted 1 year almost to the day. The price is about same I've paid in all years past as well. 2st time ordering on Amazon though but I 3xpext no changes and will buy a other one for a backup when this one does go out. I've learned its ALWAYS BEST to buy 2 at a time that way your not waiting for shipping and loosing meat. I always defr6with a blow drier and this has to be repeated every 2 days until replacement element arrives. It's a pain yes but better than smelling rotting food.

It is something we've gotten used too. It's either spend 20$ a year replacing the elements or Buying a new fridge @2k+. And I'm not down for that the thing works perfectly u til Aug rolls around..lol
This is the first time I've gotten the while kit. I've never replaced my thermostat or sensor. I think mine are working fine. title: Quality OEM part that fixed the leaking. Beware of prior rust before replacing with this.
text: Quality OEM part that fixed the leaking on my Kenmore washer. I had to use WD-40 to get the old rusted part off the metal rod, and once I did, I had to buff off all the rust. If you don't buff the rust away, you risk cracking or breaking this part and then you're just right back to the same leaking problem. Some reviewers said this wasn't a quality part because that happened to them. That's not the manufacturer's fault that you broke it because of not cleaning off the rust. Pull up a youtube video which explains exactly how to replace it. Works like a charm for me! My wife is very please about no leaks now!

title: Solid 4 stars
text: I like most things about this induction stove. The fact that I can cook two items on a stove. Top is very time, saving and very convenient. That said, when you're using both of the burners at the same time, the energy output is split between the two burners, so both of them will not be able to be on highest heat at the same time. This means that if you want to boil water for pasta, for example, it will take almost 20 minutes to get your water to boil. And it will take about 20 minutes for your pasta to cook. Another thing I don't like about the stove top is the fact that the cooking surface always looks dirty. No matter how much you clean it the circle that the pot rests on is slightly textured. And the surface never seems to come clean.

title: Lower/mid-tier choice.
text: [[VIDEOID:fbc8177e8a8fbe12ca7ad30ec95e23b4]] This hood came with a plug! A 110v plug. My electric had to cut it to hard wire it. Is that normal? IDK but I thought it weird. The lights have a long delay before they turn on. The button are clunky and loud. The suction is good, but loud. I don't think you can get away from that though. title: Elegant beverage solution
text: [[VIDEOID:ebee926b0bc202f0ea758f65f9a37092]] I've been using this for 3 months. It's held reds at cellar temperature perfectly, kept whites cold and chilled down sparkling flawlessly. I mean flawlessly! The unit's temperature can be split. The bottom can be chilled down much colder than the top. The touch screen makes it easy to see exactly what temp each zone is. The wood racks slide out completely so you can modify your interior space as needed. There is an interior light. And since the door is glass/see through, this is handy because you don't have to open the door to see your inventory. The unit is whisper quiet. It arrives set up, with the door hinge on the right side. It comes with a kit with hardware that after installed, can have the hinge be on the left. This has been a terrific solution for me. I absolutely recommend this Haier!

title: Clever invention!
text: I love this thing! My wash room is very narrow and floor space is limited. title: Great dish rack.
text: I searched and searched and ordered three dish racks before I found this one. It was the least expensive, with no bells or whistles and it works great. Very roomy, easy to clean, no weird gaps or holes where things can fall thru. When mine wears out, I will order this one again.

title: Great dryer, terrible instructions. I love the long hose for drying my boots.
text:
This has been a very nice alternative to drip-drying my riding gear in the winter & I can use it in the garage. I really love the blower hose for drying my boots. I have gear with straps & pads plus heated gear that I can't tumble dry & some of it takes forever to air dry. This dryer takes a couple of hours but hours is better than the days it would take for some of the thicker gear. The bag is very well thought out & designed. The parts fit together well, fold up small & there is a nice metal bracket inside that separates the clothes hangers inside. The storage box is nice but everything has to be separated & broken down to use it so I probably won't put it away until things warm up & I can dry outside.
The shoe adapter works well for shoes but doesn't reach far enough down to dry my boots. I have just been sticking the hose in the bottom of each boot & drying them 1 at a time which works great.
The diagrams are pretty good for assembly but using the fan & heater is very confusing just going by the instructions. Operation isn't difficult but the instructions are incomprehensible to read. There are 2 heat settings & the time is adjustable at 30 minutes intervals from 30 to 360 minutes.
There is a sticker on the side of the heater that indicates that P1 is high temperature & P2 is low temperature. That is not clear in the instructions & I had it backward at first after reading through them multiple times.
The cord is very long which is nice. There is a level switch on the heater that turns off the fan if it is tipped over. The switch is very sensitive & sometimes it's hard to get it level enough when its hanging in the bag. Even the weight of the cord can tilt it enough to turn it off.

title: Great looking, fan is quiet, love the LED lights. New install was a big job for me
text:
The hood looks great & matches our other SS appliances well. It goes a long way to tying the room together. The fan is very quiet on low & acceptable on high. I thought my wife would object to the sound on high but she didn't think it was too much & we probably wouldn't run it on high all that much anyway.
We love the LED lights & use them a lot. They do a great job of illuminating the range and the spaces under the cabinets on either side. I do wish it had a dimmer knob or multiple setting for the LEDs. I mounted it at 30" above the counter which was about 28" above the range. It seemed high at first but, after 2 weeks in the kitchen, it is perfectly natural.
The stainless steel on the hood is very easy to wipe clean. The stainless on the chimney collected a lot of fingerprints during installation & is harder to clean. I don't anticipate the upper parts needing to be cleaned all that much but it was an observation.
The installation instructions are very good & I appreciate that. They provide charts for where the screws should go to achieve the desired height above the range instead of making the installer figure out the drops & all that. There are 2 places in the instructions that say "height above 36" High range" which was very confusing. I must have read through it a dozen times before I came to the conclusion that it probably meant '36" WIDE range'.
This is the first time I have installed one of these & I expected it to be a big job. We renovated the kitchen in this house before we moved in & the only thought I had to the vent hood was to drop an electrical outlet in the space. The hood needs framing behind the drywall to mount, everything else can be hung with the included drywall hangers. I had to move my outlet from the center to the side, drop in some wood behind the drywall & I also modified the mounting plate to connect directly to a stud that was off-center. It looks rough but it's all hidden behind the chimney now. Simply replacing an old vent probably wouldn't involve all of that.
Final mounting & assembly with the connected pipe & chimney pieces was tricky for me. Now that I have done it, I would do it in a different order than the instructions stated but an experienced installer probably already knows that.
The hood arrived very well packed & with a thick plastic wrap around the stainless parts. That kind of detail & the good instructions leads me to believe this is going to be a quality product.

title: Very nice Range Hood
text: We purchased this range hood with the LED light option for our kitchen remodel and could not be happier. It looks great in the kitchen. The LED lights illuminate the range perfectly. The fan can be a bit loud on the higher settings, but lower speeds have minimal noise. Highly recommended.

title: Good if it fits your fridge
text: This is a pretty decent absorbent pad, it can help prevent excessive water collecting under your fridge's water or ice outlet. It's not exactly a one size fits all solution, however. title: Great for adults too
text: This is a great way to secure a standard door refrigerator. I volunteer for a food distribution pantry that often stores items in a fridge for later. We have had people ignore the signs not to touch, so a simple lock like this is often enough to deter. The mechanism isn't perfect, I've definitely used easier and smoother combination locks but I love how easy this is to install. You can use adhesive or screws (both included), but it will not work well on French Door style fridges. For what we needed, it works well so far!

title: Good for office / travel
text:
This is a great little counter-friendly ice maker. I've never tried one of these before, so it was really interesting to watch. My kids were fascinated by the way it freezes on little spindles, then drops them into a tray, then a little plastic mechanical sweeping arm lifts and dumps the ice cubes (or cylinders, they aren't actually cubes) into the front where you can scoop them out with the included utensil.
The whole process takes 6-7 minutes to get started before you see the first deposit of formed ice. It's actually really neat and useful in an office or school setting where you might not have access to a freezer or ice machine. It is not very large, but if you have a small workplace where people would like iced coffee, it is a pretty useful tool!

title: Does not fit my washer.
text:
I have an LG LDS4821ST that needs a replacement heater part with this model number. Unfortunately, this one does not make a good seal around the opening, causing the part to leak when the tub fills with water during a cycle.
The etching/writing on it looks a little bit different from the one it is replacing, as well as the material used for the rubber gasket (the older one looks like it has a line/crease going through the middle, this one does not). I tried one from a different supplier (not on Amazon) and it also claimed to be a real LG part yet looks like this one and also leaks. On that one, I was told maybe I had to tighten it more, so I tightened the nut and it still leaked. I tightened it more, and it still leaked again. Finally I took it out to my old one back in (it doesn't heat, but at least I can clean my dishes on the Quick cycle without the drying mode) and it worked fine. The one I overtightened came out bent from tightening it so hard the metal actually warped. No one can claim I didn't try tightening it enough now.

I'm guessing they changed the manufacturing and the new ones don't seal properly in the older washers like mine. The older one went in and sealed without overly tightening it again. I'm not sure where to find a good one other than ebay now for a used one.
Some people claim this works for them, so I'm guessing they have newer washers than mine. Two stars because it's a good price compared to other suppliers online if this model works for you. Otherwise, if you're trying to revive an older washer like mine, I'd say go elsewhere. Zero stars.

title: Not so compact, but works.
text:
I've used portable dishwashers before and they are AWESOME for people who travel or have dietary restrictions (Kosher, for example, need separate washers for milk and meat dishes). The good news is, this actually seems like it does a decent job and even comes with some complimentary detergent and jet dry in the box, so you can get up and running right away... in some cases, at least. I say that because depending on how you hook it up, you may need additional hardware to connect to your water lines and/or sink.
Here's my problem with it- they claim it is a "countertop" style washer, but the thing is actually too big for my counter! I don't have enough clearance under the cabinets to fit, and it has a lot of hoses and tubing to connect as well. I was considering drilling into my counter to feed the tubes to the water supply and drain, but decided to try connecting to the sink instead when we saw it wasn't fitting well under the cabinets. But then it is too close to the sink and with the hoses etc connected, it looks like it is taking over the kitchen more than just an appliance on the counter like a toaster.
I've seen smaller counter-top dishwashers that would easily fit better in our space. Perhaps this one does a better job, but at this point I feel like it is too big to fit the way I intended to use it, but too small to be one we install permanently in the cabinet space. Perhaps someone else will find this size useful, I'm a little disappointed because I was so excited for this to work.

title: No filter required, and good for travel!
text:
I like the size of this and the fact that it doesn't require filters. This is good for travelling and even camping, since it is relatively easy to use and clean and doesn't require much else to work. The mesh is good about keeping the grounds out of your coffee, however I did notice a little more at the bottom of my cup than I do with a paper filter. Perhaps I need to try a more coarse grind, as fine grounds are getting through a little.
What makes it so petite are the arms that fold up for storage and then fold out to hold itself over the cup. The only issue with this, however, is that the arms hold the filter partially submerged, so you can never fill the cup to the top. If using with a tall mug, this is fine, especially if you leave room for milk. But with a standard 8 or 10 oz disposable cup, you might find that you can't get enough coffee out of it at a time as the filter sits about 1/4 of the cup down.
It definitely has its uses, but know the limitations before you get it.

title: Comes with wire nuts!
text: We have a minor defect in our oven that causes the igniter to burn out semi-annually, so having a supply of these on Amazon has been a blessing (cheaper to keep swapping it vs replacing the oven!). Usually it is just the bare igniter, but this one also comes with a spare set of porcelain heat-resistant wire nuts! That's a huge bonus since one time I accidentally broke off some wire inside the nut and couldn't reuse my original ones. None of the local hardware stores had the heat resistant kind like these in stock so I needed to order them separately on Amazon last time this happened. But with this set, you really have everything you might need to change the igniter yourself, including spare nuts if needed. Very pleasantly surprised. Very highly recommended for a DIYer over alternatives!

title: Great for keeping track of comfort levels
text:
I have an old home that doesn't necessarily heat/cool evenly. And even then, sometimes the humidity here in the Northeast means we feel uncomfortable at different temperatures. This is a great tool to monitor how things are doing in different rooms in the house despite the house thermostat reading. The humidity is really useful to know as well. I've learned a lot about my house just leaving this in different rooms for a day or two at a time.
It is easy to use thanks to a touchscreen, and the backlight is a nice feature but not entirely necessary. I like that it comes with batteries so everything you need is in the box already. I've always wanted one of these after seeing them in other homes, and it is everything I wanted it to be. Very happy with it.

title: Worked perfectly, fixed our dryer
text:
I couldn't find this part in local stores and most part places would charge me more than it costs in shipping to get it to me the same week. Thank goodness for Prime shipping, I was able to find this here and have it within 48 hours. Dryer is working great, and I have a backup in case whatever caused the fuse to blow in the first place wasn't fixed properly (I think it was just too much lint buildup, I cleaned it out before replacing with this).
So far so good, couldn't be happier with it!

title: A fraction of the repair cost compared to calling an appliance guy!
text:
We have an old Caloric brand wall oven that came with the house. I have no idea how old it is, but within a year or two of living here, the oven stopped working. It would glow, but no gas would come out and it would never start. I called an appliance repair man who determined it was a bad ignitor. He explained to me that the gas won't turn on until the ignitor reaches a certain temp, so either the ignitor wasn't getting hot enough, or it wasn't sending the signal to turn on the gas when it did. Either way, the problem was entirely with the ignitor. He replaced it, and something like $200 later, the oven was back to working. Until it stopped working again about a year after that. This time it didn't even glow, the oven would just do nothing.

Instead of another expensive repair, I decided on a hunch to assume the part the repair man brought was lower quality than the original. I looked it up online and found a match here on Amazon. I felt confident that I could swap it myself now that I saw the repair guy do it, and sure enough this did the trick for a fraction of what I would pay him to come back! Its been a little over a month since putting it in, and so far so good. I'm hoping this will last longer than the last one, but even if it doesn't, worst case scenario is that I'll spend $20-30 on an annual repair until we can afford to replace the whole oven! I can deal with that.

title: BLUEFALL GE MWF Refrigerator Water Filter
text: For such a small filter this product does a hug job! After having used this filter my whole family has been drinking more water because it tasted great! I always thought that it was too good to be true to have water from the fridge that tastes great, but this water filter defiantly proved me wrong. In addition, installation was such a breeze and its such a small filter that it does not take-up too much room in the fridge. title: BEWARE! The design changed so these no longer fit as designed, I made it work though.
text: Bosch changed the design of how the tab at the end of this cord connects to the spring which regulates the soft opening of the dishwasher door (our dishwasher is 5-6 years old).  This tab doesn't insert into the original plastic clip on the spring, buyer beware.  In the end I removed the plastic clip from the spring and simply threaded the new cord through the coils of the spring and used the plastic tab on the end of the cord to act as a stop from pulling through the coil.  The tension of the spring coils keeps the tab locked inside the barrel of the spring.  For now this solution works, the tension is a bit too tight and I imagine after many uses the spring will "saw" though the cord but after spending all the time pulling out my dishwasher to discover this part is no longer correct I decided to make it work and I did.  Best of luck!

title: The easiest way to make good coffee anywhere
text: This is the 5th one I've bought - all the previous ones were nicked by my friends or I gave them away. Look, good coffee anywhere is not difficult. You pack this, and some filters in your kit. If you are going somewhere with good coffee, get it there, if not, put some nice ground coffee in a bag and add that to your kit. If you will be somewhere with mugs, use those, if not, add a mug to your kit. So if you will be on a ship crossing the Pacific with only instant coffee on board for 4 weeks you pack this doohicky, about 30 filters, enough ground coffee for 30 days, your favorite mug, and you're set! Easier to clean than a french press, far less breakable too.  I just added a kit to my tiny travel trailer. Just say NO to coffee pods!

title: Fixed the Squeak
text: My dryer started squeaking and squealing like a stuck pig--and a quick google search revealed it was probably the "supports" and these parts were listed.  I only spent $40 on the dryer 6 years ago (used), so I was hoping the repair wouldn't be too costly. Well, this kit doubled the value of my dryer!  Turns out three of the four supports were worn to oblivion.  My dad came up and the two of us were able to make the repair fairly easily (it was work, don't get me wrong, but other than trying to get the belt around the pulley, it wasn't HARD work, just a little effort.) Way better than having to pay someone to do it!  We replaced all four supports, the arch, foam and the belt (which wasn't worn, but figured since we had it open might as well).  Here's hoping to another 6+ years!  The parts fit perfectly and it was pretty easy to figure out with the diagrams and a little smarts.

So first of I figured I would see if I would have this issue with this filter and I am happy to report I do not! The water where I live has a taste so I prefer not to drink it straight out of the faucet and prefer it from my fridge, hey I got it so why not use it! With this filter I have no complaints whatsoever.

I just got this filter and this is my review based on about 2 weeks or so, so we will see how it will work out in the long run and if it will last the 6 months that I did get out of the Samsung filter and the other one, but so far I am not complaining and will stick to this brand in the future purchases.

With these bags, all I had to do was fill it up, cover in water, then pull it out and set it in a strainer over my pitcher.  I was able to walk away a bit more.  When it was done, I turned it inside out into a bag to transfer it to my compost pit, rinsed it, and all was well!  No, it doesn't return to its beige color.  Once you've used it, the coffee definitely colors the bag, but it's fine.  I love it and will be using it all summer!  :)

title: Metal filter doesn't work
text:
Pros:
- Collapses very small so I can take it with me anywhere, also quite light
- Silicone is washable and reusable
- Does hold its form while brewing
- Compatible with standard Melitta paper filters (flat cone with flat base)
- Compatible with a range of diameters of cups or travel mugs

Cons:
- Despite the air hole, can develop a seal to the cup
- Can't see through it to tell how far along the cup is
- A little dangerous to lift it up while brewing to check fill level, since it's squishy
- Metal filter will either pop out of place, sending the entire filter full of grounds into your cup, or (if you're very lucky) stay put and only allow about 1/3 cup to brew before clogging. This is when using beans ground to the “drip” setting by my local roaster. May have better luck with coarser grounds.

Overall assessment:
Not annoying enough to replace, but annoying enough that I won't recommend it. If you do choose to buy this, use with paper filters.

title: Direct replacement for OEM, interior cartridge rattles.
text:
[[VIDEOID:756db57a0a5f292ae2d8a278120107f7]] The filters arrived as described with no issues from shipping. I inspected both filters and the only thing I noticed different from the OEM was the cartridge inside the canister rattled. The OEM filter does not. This concerned me initially but all the water does is pass into the canister through the filter material and out. After reviewing pictures I can speculate it is due to a free floating design and that the space inside the cartridge allows for water passage around and through the filter material, thus accounting for the rattle. I do not believe the rattling affects the filters ability to function as intended.

Another thing that I noticed was a date on the box of 12/21/2022. I do not know what this means but since it does not have exp. in front I will assume it is a manufactured/packaged dated.

So, I was able to install the filter with no problems. Water cycled through without leaking. After a few gallons cycled to remove air, activity the material and clean out the line I tasted the water with no discernible differences from before to after replacement. The USWF filter is stated to be 0.5 micro, which is good and will capture very small particles but I can not substantiate this. All I can say is the filter installed with no issues, it did not leak and water tasted good from the dispenser.

Overall, it is a descent replacement filter. Since both filters rattled I assume this is not a defect but just how it is designed. I will monitor for leaks and update my post accordingly. Based on value, form, fit and function I would recommend.

title: Great affordable replacement air filter.
text:
The Binazon LT120F air filters arrived in a small box which each filter individually wrapped. Upon inspection, I found no issues with any of them. I removed the existing air filter which was an OEM filter and refrigerator and compared them. The only differences were color tint and the Binazon had more tape, one piece per side while OEM only had two pieces. The Binazon is actually a better quality fair filter in my opinion.

Measurements are close to those stated in the ad. The difference is not enough to matter about 1/16”. The Binazon appear to be made from the same material as OEM…plastic. The Binazon filter fit right into the mount and was easliy installed with no issues.

These are a great buy for the price and overall quality. I would recommend to others.

I have had no issues with deterioration of filter material or charcoal escapement since I have been using. Overall, these are a great affordable alternative to the OEM.

In the pictures the one on the left is Keurig's and subject filter is on the right.

title: I had a very hard time getting it to light, burns pizza on the backside while the front needs more
text:
This was my very first time using a pizza oven. It took MANY tries to get it lit. After giving up a few times and trying again and again, I did get it lit.

It is hard to comprehend but after only 30 seconds you will need to rotate your pizza 180 degrees to help it cook more evenly. Every 20 seconds might even be better.

I got no instructions as how to cook pizza in it. I had to watch videos and read online about them.

Be sure to preheat your oven. YouTube videos say to preheat it for about 20 minutes on high. I did this. I used a infrared thermometer to check the heat on the pizza stone at the front and the back. There was well over 200 degrees difference on the front and back of the stone. Is this normal?

There has to be a much better design with more even heat.

I was very excited to get this. I went out and got enough stuff to make many pizzas. I was so underwhelmed with the whole thing that I will probably make my next pizza in the oven. I can actually see in my oven. You can't see the back of the pizza in this pizza oven, so it is hard to tell when it is burning. Since the front is not done, it can fool you.

I am guessing that after this sits around for a while and doesn't get used that I will give it away.

Sorry, this just not live up to my hopes.

title: Great K-Cup Alternative
text:
I started purchasing loose ground coffee and wanted reusable K-cups so I don't have to purchase a separate coffee machine. I'm able to use this with my regular sized Keurig, but need to remove the inner plastic ring for my Keurig Mini Plus in order for this cup to fit. It takes a bit of testing with different types of ground coffee to figure out how much to fill the cup with to have the maximum coffee flavor and strength without getting coffee sludge at the bottom of your cup. I wish this cup would have a marker on the inside to indicate how much to fill it up to. Another con is that the top of the cap doesn't lock or snap shut. If you're like me and wanted to prefill the cups every 4 days so you can grab and go, I recommend putting it in a glass airtight container (if you want to be more eco-friendly) or else the coffee might lose its flavor from the air exposure. Aside from that, I don't have any other complaints about the product. The metal mesh is fine enough to keep most coffee grounds out of your cup. If you want a ground free coffee, you may need to put a paper coffee filter in your cup because the finest grounds will still fall through the mesh.

In comparison to the Keurig universal K-cup, I would say I prefer the universal K-cup more. I like my coffee to be strong and bold with flavor. K-cup Keurig sells has a larger capacity to hold more coffee grounds that allows me to get that result I want with minimal to no sludge (although requires removal of the plastic ring for both of my Keurigs to fit). If you are picky with your coffee, I would recommend the one Keurig sells (even though it's more expensive). If you want a simple and quick cup of coffee, be more eco-friendly, or want to have a multiple amount of K-cups on hand to fill, I think this product will work great for you.

text:
[[VIDEOID:1d8cc7d89fc2c35b7d5befd1840ba4e5]] I read other reviews and someone recommended to buy the 7 piece faucet adapter, which I also recommend.
Also, make sure you can screw onto the sink you plan on using..
When I received my portable washer, The drain hose and the water attachment were too short. I called the company to try to get a longer hose and water attachment but they said they don't have longer attachments and to try Home Depot or Lowe's… I was able to find another hose that connected to my current hose and it seals with a metal clap. However, I had to order the water attachment from Amazon. I measured to make sure I ordered the correct length… I wasn't happy with the screw part of the hose, but luckily I realized I didn't need that part! It pops off, and you'll be able to connect to the washers provided attachment which the piece provided should attach to one of the 7 sink attachments…
So, once I got it set up… it seems to work just fine! I've only done a few small loads but I'm happy with it and recommend it to anyone who needs one! I live in an apartment and it's not too loud. title: Wet ice. Loud machine. Flimsy Buttons
text:
So, I came across this product and bought it based on the number of stars/reviews and features. The product looks gorgeous on the counter. I have the red/gray one.

Looks are deceiving.

Let me say that the buttons are very flimsy. When pushing them I feel like it's gonna cave in. You have the ability to select between the small or large ice, only the large is not large at all (see pic). Its small…. And wet!! The ice doesn't come out like the way a freezer would make ice. Once the @9 min cycle is done it pauses and then dumps the little cubes. I wish it had a bit more insulation to prevent the ice from being so wet. It barely gets the drink cold(er). Ice melts way too fast. So what I ended up doing was transferring the cubes into our lower freezer. I am the type of person that requires ice all the time in my drinks. And we have had problems with our fridge system with the ice maker and water dispenser. 4 times they repaired our fridge and it is only 4 years old. Anyways, I wanted a product that would produce the right ice. My parents have a portable and their ice is fantastic. I had hoped this would have done the job. This product is not what I expected it to be. I guess this is where they say you get what you pay for.

I am on the fence on whether to return it or throw it away. Sounds silly, I know. Perhaps opt for the return. The ice maker is NOT that great. I see many reviews where other customers are quite happy and then videos posted of issues where the product's internal components are really messed up. That scares me. And how I missed all that when I researched this is just my stupidity.

Only last thing… this product is NOT quiet. Its very loud and scares my cats!! I guess in a weird way it will keep them off that counter at least! Lol
