title: I wanted to love it, but it's getting returned.
text: I bought this to take on an extended cruise with me. I knew that it didn't hold very much and accepted that. It doesn't hold much, but it washes a lot less than it holds. Just one pair of thin Capri pants was too much for it. It would start to wash it and then it would quit and start beeping. Even T-shirts and underwear wouldn't wash most of the time without setting off the limit alarm. And then when you actually got something washed, and you tried to use the spin cycle, all the stuff would fly out of the spin basket. The basket needs a lid. It also needs to be bigger. I ended up wrapping rubber bands around it to keep the clothes in but that's kind of ridiculous at the price point for this item. Another annoyance is the fact that the lid won't stay on when you store it vertically. I don't know how difficult it would've been to make the lid snap into place, but that would've been a big help as it rattles a lot when the machine is working as well. Like I said, I loved the idea but the actual product does not meet expectations.

title: Good for travel
text: So, I'm about to go on an 18 day cruise, and I think this is going to be perfect for that. It's small. That's the first and most important thing that you need to know. You will not be able to wash a pair of jeans in this. I washed one pair of thin Capri pants and I felt like that was pushing the envelope. But I can do a pair of undies and a T-shirt. I will say that it's probably better to go with one of the brands that has a spin cycle if the extra cost is in your budget. Because it does cut down on the drying time considerably. But if you don't care about that, save the money and go for this one.

title: Great little freezer.
text: This little freezer sits out in my shed, which gets very hot in the Florida summer, and worked without a hitch. It's very quiet and keeps the food frozen rocksolid. The only thing it's missing is a light, and I used a battery stick up motion sensor closet light inside. The batteries don't last as long in the freezer but that's OK. Would definitely buy this again.

title: Made the dryer run like new
text: Our dryer was taking forever to dry clothes. After we replaced the element it works like new. Gotta be somewhat handy to do this though.

title: Keeping the beer cold now...
text: This $23 part saved me from buying a new fridge. Check out YouTube for videos on how easy it is to change. I took off one star since it came with absolutely zero paperwork, not even a wiring diagram. It would have been nice to doublecheck that the wires definitely connected to the same terminals the old ones did. Or a little warranty info, or company info. But no, just a part in a box in a box in yet another box.

title: Well made
text: Were well made. Exactly as described. Look very nice. Well packaged. No scratches or dents. Very well satisfied!

title: Inexpensive but costly
text: This was a little different than the original and the hoses all leaked. I'm looking into replacing them now.  I regret this purchase.

title: Not great for Frigidaire
text: I was disappointed with this filter. Even though description said that this filter like original from manufacture but is not. I had a hard time to inserted completely. Cover doesn't completely cover the space between refrigerator and filter . I wouldn't be buying it again.

title: It feet and works perfectly for Frigidaire
text: I was nicely surprised. This water filter feet my Frigidaire refrigerator like manufactured one and for the the fraction of the cost. It was easy to install, and cover already was attached to it. I would definitely continue buying again. Zero problem make a happy customer.

title: Not for Keureg 2.0 K550
text: I have a Keureg 2.0 K550. Doesn't work with the filters. I tried several times and it overflows or I got the pressure error. Probably giving to my father in law since his 1.0 can use the filters.

title: Good quality, don't overfill, don't use filter.
text:
Cups work well, but make sure you don't overfill them. My other ones had more mesh to release the water and these have less. Don't use filters for easier cleaning, they overfill and make a mess or you get the pressure error. Otherwise they are not bad.

I have tried the other purple ones that have more mesh but the quality was not as a good as these. I may try the gold mesh next time to see if they are any better once these wear out.

title: I would recommend this
text: Never would have thought of buying something like this, but my washing machine is right next to an exit door and the washer door was constantly being shut. This contraption works perfectly and so easy.

title: Burner covers check to ensure your stove mode will fit
text: Need to make sure they will fit the brand of stove you have

title: Protects my appliances perfectly
text: It was so quick and easy to set up and it's very easy to access the washer and dryer for use. Does what I need it to do whether I'm using the appliances or not.

title: came in quickly
text: worked great to fix my dishwasher

title: desk
text: I really like this desk and am so pleased with it. Assembly was simple. The desk with drawers come attached, no assembly for that part. The only thing that needs to be done is installing the legs and the knobs on the drawers. All the legs are the same (even though they bow out) so you wont mix them up. I installed them all with two screws first, to get them in place, then went back and added the other two screws and tightened everything. It was a little difficult with the angle of the legs and using the tool to tighten the screws. I decided to swap out the gold knobs that came with it for some crystal knobs (to match my decor). The drawers have ample space and the desk has great quality. I would have given it 5 stars but the top of the desk scuff easily. The scuffs do come off if you wipe it, but I dont like that it does that. Overall highly recommend.

title: Refillable coffee pods
text: These coffee pods are larger than a normal coffee pod. I tried them in my Mr. Coffee machine that brews single cups with K pods. I tried to fit this item into the cup and it would not close. I tried with all four and got the same results. The quality was very nice and I felt like they would work well for brewing single cups of coffee. They would have been nice, but they are not the same size as traditional coffee pods so they don't fit.

title: Not entirely useful replacement part if the original can't be removed?
text: Before you buy this, try removing the old one.  And good luck removing the old one.

title: So hard to find large tea cases like this.  Nice and roomy for larger pitchers
text: A screw or some type of mechanism to keep the cap on would have been great.

title: Excellent large tea/coffee "bag".  A little smaller than a normal sized man's fist.
text: The lid does not attach however.  But since there are two protruding lips on the body, a simple rubber band will firmly hold it in place (if you'd like to submerge this into a cooler like I wanted to).

title: Works. Fits in my LG. Oh and if ...
text: Works.  Fits in my LG.  Oh and if you are trying to replace your old one, force is not the way to go, there is a trick to it.

title: Just okay
text: Not long enough for my refrigerator. The color is a little darker than the image

title: Ok
text: A little expensive. Can purchase else where for cheaper but it was an emergency next day delivery so I paid the price. Flavor could be better.

title: Don't know
text: This did fit because of the Chip for GE.

title: Highly recommend
text: Great purchase. Looking to replace old one fir my Samsung dryer. Fits perfectly.

title: Good buy
text: This complements the metal pods. It does exactly what it says. Sturdy and durable.

title: so far so good
text:
#1 don't store in your garage! duh
#2 open it once a week (plan ahead)
#3 don't let anythin mess with the seal
#4 listen for the hiss when u close, long hiss? put freezer in dry location; short hiss? gooooood
had mine for 2 years now, no need to defrost, not once!

title: Good ice maker
text: Ice isn't as clear as I'd hoped it would be

title: Four Stars
text: work great but haven't washed them yet....

title: Four Stars
text: love it but haven't wash them yet....

title: Lightweight and portable, but be aware that volume is small!
text: The washer is very lightweight and easy to use, and customer service was phenomenal. I ended up sending it back because it fit less clothing than I needed especially after adding water, but the portability makes up for it. Keep in mind you can't stuff it all the way since the water will overflow, but for 2-3 light pieces of clothing, it's an excellent machine.

title: Made life easy
text: Dies work. Just make sure floor is level or you'll see a side slipping out

title: Three Stars
text: Serves it's purpose

title: Five Stars
text: Worked perfectly

title: Not a good dwal
text: Item was returned. Very cheaply made.

title: Great price and fast shipping
text: Looks great. Works well. I really like this new cooktop.

title: Safe way to store Eggs in volumn
text: I buy a lot of eggs and I was stacking them and they were getting bumped and we would lose a few and I would find a sale and try to figure out the best use of space to store them and this has been the solution to our problems. It's very nicely made.

title: Not perfect, but pretty close.
text: I've been on the search for the perfect ice maker for a while. I don't like the big cubes my freezer makes and we go through a LOT of ice. I do love the nugget ice and this is pretty fast getting started. It does a good job producing ice and the ice tastes good. The machine was easy to set up (I didn't read the instructions -- just plugged it in and filled it up). After a couple of cleaning cycles, it started making ice. I like the ice. I can live with the speed - it's not superfast but it's fast enough for us. Cleaning cycle is easy. I wish it had a bigger basket so we'd have more ice at a time but that's not a deal breaker and I really, really wish we could hook to a water supply without having to hire a plumber to come in an replumb the entire place but those are things I'll live with. All in all, while it's a bit pricey, the size is a bit larger than I love and it's heavier than I wish it was, it does a good job and makes good ice. Very reliable.

title: Better than plastic
text: I've tried the plastic refillable k-cup pods and they are okay but these are way better. They don't leave any off taste, they are easy to use and clean up easily. I don't use a keurig that often, but when I travel, it's easier to take these and make my own from freshly ground coffee beans. That way I get coffee I like the taste of and the ease of not having to go to a coffee shop for a decent cup.

title: Close to perfect but….
text: I'm turning into an ice machine junkie in my search for the perfect ice machine. While this isn't it, it's getting closer. I've tried everything from top of the line to cheap and find that this price point has closer to the features I love. I like the cube size option in this but have ended up settling for the large cubes. They are soft enough that they get my drinks cold. I do like that I can have alexa turn it on in the morning so I have a full bin of ice when I get up. The filling and emptying are both easy which is super nice and the slim profile allows it to fit right into the small space that I have for it on my counter, right next to the sink (easy fill, easy empty). Not too much noise. I actually like that as the ice melts it is recycled to make more ice and doesn't tend to clump up.

title: On the fence
text: I've dragged my feet on this review because I'm so on the fence. I love the ice it produces. There are a lot of pluses but they are outweighed by the negatives IMO. The ice is good, I love the nuggets and having the attached water reservoir is a real plus. Also the thing looks great and it's easy to put a glass underneath, press a button and you get ice. On the other hand, the water reservoir is hard to refill, I need to get out a funnel and fill it with that. The machine frequently goes into 'defrost' mode, especially when you want ice. The ice doesn't start that quickly so you have to plan ahead (maybe 10-15 minutes) and then have to hope that it won't go into defrost mode for no reason at all. I've left it off for a couple of days and it still defrosts. I followed all the tips and hints and there should be no issues but I am finally putting it away and replacing it with something that's easier to use. One day there will be a perfect ice maker but unfortunately this isn't it.

title: My coffee and the Keurig
text: I was tired of using substandard coffee in my keurig so ordered these and now I can use my Kona beans in my easy to use drip coffee maker. They are easy to use and easy to fill and easy to clean. Finding the right grind took a try or two but once I had it now I can get a decent cup of coffee that perfect for my tastes.

title: Not perfect but getting there
text: I haven't attached this to a water source yet and that may really improve the overall usage. This is a pretty nice ice maker. We go through a lot of ice, especially in the summer and this does the job. It makes that fabulous ice that is easy to chew on, gets the drinks really cold and doesn't clump together. Right now, its annoying to have to fill it and it does produce the ice into a stack so it gets "full" before it's really full. You DO need to use the scoop to get the ice into smaller mouthed containers but also not a deal breaker. Its awkward to add water, you have to remove the bin and pour the water into the slot but it comes with the hookup for the water supply and I expect we'll do that since we like the ice and its speedy.

title: These work as they should
text: These do what they are supposed to do but they are quite large in size and that doesn't always make them easy to use. I love the product but I'll be looking for something smaller size-wise in the future.

title: It's easy to clean up with this
text: I'm not sure why I waited so long to get one of these. I make bread and biscuits a lot and this sure makes clean up a breeze. I use it to roll out pastry, pizza crust and biscuits. It's so easy to clean which is why its so great. While it is non-stick, I still dust with flour, maybe I could skip that step but somehow it doesn't sound like a good thing. But I can pick it up, shake off anything and rinse it clean or toss it in the dishwasher. Great add on and it's easy to store.

title: Does a good job
text: I've tried several egg holders and this one is better than most. It's easy to use and easy to clean the eggs do exactly what they are supposed to do. Like anything its a pain to load it (it's not that hard it's just an extra step) but the eggs roll down like they are supposed to. We go through stages where we get a lot of eggs from our chickens and we keep it full, at other times, when not in use, it can be removed although we usually don't bother. So far no broken eggs.

title: Cute and useful
text: I originally got this as a frothing pitcher but find it works just as well as a placeholder under my coffee machine. I keep it right under the spout and it collects the coffee that I can then pour into my cup. Sturdy and useful. I just rinse it out and then put it back and it's ready for tomorrow. Gives me a couple of minutes to get my drinking mug ready and when I'm ready the coffee is ready. I expect I could use it for something else, but I'm perfectly happy with it right where it is.

title: Well they work but….
text: So I'll say right off that these do what they are supposed to do and allow me to make capsules from my own beans which I love but it is a hassle and most of the time it's just easier to pop in a capsule and go. I do sometimes take the time when I want the “perfect” cup but for me the ease of just popping in a ready-made capsule takes the cake. I also have found a couple of types of capsules that I like so if you are having trouble pinning down a good flavor, this might make more sense for you.

title: Best egg holders
text: I've tried any number of containers to hold my eggs and this one works best for me. The lid comes off so if I need to get several eggs I just lift them out. I washed them in the top rack of my dishwasher and they have a lid so I can put things on top if necessary They stack together nicely and protect the eggs while keeping them safe from banging around. I can also easily see what's there and how many I have.

title: Works?
text: I had trouble in the beginning with this since you have to have the correct grind and fill the capsule to the right level but once I got it, I have more positives than failures. It does work fine and now I can make my own capsules to get the flavor I want. I'd obviously prefer to be able to purchase the “perfect” capsules but since I haven't found any I like better than my freshly roasted and ground beans, I'll put in the time for that perfect cup. It's pretty easy once you get the grind and level right.

title: More trouble than I want to invest
text: These take a lot of work to make happen. I was hoping to be able to “make” my own capsules but you have to be sure to grind the coffee fine enough (and then sometimes it still didn't deliver the results I expected) you also have to use a previous capsules foil which has the code on it. Just these made the whole process more time consuming than I wanted. I tried a few, now I'm onto testing various types of existing capsules to find my “perfect” blend. That's me..if having your own custom capsules are worth it and you want to put in the time and effort, this might be worth a try.

title: Fit my J9
text: I've got a couple of Jura machines and it seems that one or another always needs something. These fit my J9 perfectly and I can't tell the difference between the name brand and these. They went right in and have been holding up a “normal” amount of time.

title: I was excited to get this.
text: I thought I was getting the top of the line ice maker and was really happy. It was a hassle to set it up (not really difficult but more than just plug and go) and I like that there is a filter but the execution leaves something to be desired. The ice production isn't steady, sometimes it works perfectly and other times I wonder what happened. I haven't used the crushed ice feature because it's been hard enough sometimes to get ice. When it works, it's wonderful but it's not dependable. I guess I'll be going back to my basic model which at least delivered consistent ice.

title: I'll never use the ice maker in my freezer again
text: Great new appliance. I like that I can double filter the water that I run through this and I get ice fast. At first it bothered me a little about the size and shape of the cubes but now that I'm used to it - speed is the answer. You do have to use it or put it in the freezer because the machine doesn't keep it cold but I've started it the day before (or even a few days before) and just store the ice in the freezer for when I have a party. The ice tastes better than the ice that my freezer turns out.

title: This is getting a workout
text: I've got this in my house in Florida and it's getting a workout - we can't keep enough ice during the summer which isn't a problem with just the regular people who live here but when the hordes invade there isn't enough ice. We go tired of going to the store for bags and having to keep them cold. When we know we are having guests we stock pile some but this really helps. It's easy to use - plug it in and harvest the ice as it comes out. Convenient drain so nothing gets stagnant and it's easy to fill, easy to use, pretty fast and easy to clean and store.

title: Easy to use and saves space
text: This stores very nicely in a small spot I have below the meat bin in my fridge which is almost wasted space. I normally keep my eggs there but now I can see exactly what I've got at a glance without having to haul out the cartons and count them. It was weird at first to now have the eggs "safe" in the carton but they don't rattle around and overall it makes the whole egg process easier to handle.

title: Fits my Ena
text: I have an Ena at my summer home and this fits perfectly. Slides right in and purifies the water. I do use filtered water anyway but the machine requires this to keep running. Nice to find it — it fits and is way less than the name brand.

title: Egg storage
text: Stackable egg storage that has grooves for the eggs to settle into an a lid. They do stack nicely in the fridge although you do have to pull them out to unlatch them - not a biggie but you won't be able to just reach in and grab an egg. They do take up less room in the fridge and make getting to the eggs easier.

title: Better than cartons
text: This allows us to keep way more eggs in a smaller space but I'm not sure I love the lid. It almost seems like it's better for transport rather than storage but it'll do the job. Sturdy and easy to stack which makes our fridge even more effective (we'll see how long it stays so organized....).

title: Flat and fits lots of eggs
text: This is a very nice egg holder. I can see what's there and the eggs feel like they are less likely to roll around. These fit into the fridge perfectly and I love that they are drawers so I don't have move things to get to the eggs. I'll be buying more of these.

title: Nicely shaped, no drips
text: I generally use this as a catch for my Jura to rinse into unless I'm making cappuccino (which isn't a frequent occurrence). This is nicely shaped, doesn't take a ton of extra room, fits easily under the spouts and doubles as a frothing pitcher when needed. Very sturdy, no drips. Love it!

title: It works, it's fast and easy!
text: This has all my favorite things about a kettle - it heats fast, it works everytime without fail and with a wide mouth it's easy to fill and empty. I wasn't sure I was going to love a clear glass one (I've always had non-see through) but this is great - I can actually see it working and the pot lifts off the base which has a cord storage. Not sure what could go wrong except maybe if it didn't work. It works!

title: Arrived in the nick of time
text: My last frothing pitcher had just died when this arrived so it went to work right away. It's easy to use, works perfectly and goes into the dishwasher. I also use it to make single cup of coffee or tea in and then I move it to my cup. Smooth and sleek it does what it's supposed to and looks good doing it.

title: Works. Arrived on time.
text: Works great, arrived on time. Instructions were non-existent but how hard is to change a filter?

title: Five Stars
text: Much cheaper than the name brand and just as good, highly recommend these filters.

title: Time For A Change....Only Not.
text: I have had this dish rack for the last 8 years and it has endured the trials of drying LOTS of dishes for my family of 11. Gradually, some of the kids have grown up and moved out, but this dish rack continues to do the job for the 2 that are still home, my husband, and myself. One piece of plastic that divides the dishes is now broken and the most vigorous scrubbing no longer gets it clean, so I was more than a little excited when my husband suggested that we finally retire the old one. Surely there must be some major advances in dish rack technology over the last decade, I thought. But no. After spending way too much time researching what is on the market, it appears that this model remains the best choice for people who need large dish racks with lots of flexibility in how it can be loaded. Ratings for other brands were significantly lower even for models five times the price and from well known kitchen product manufacturers. So, I will be sticking with the tried and true, although this decade I will going with the red to match my cherry Le Creuset pans and KitchenAid small appliances. Maybe I will have to consider designing a functional large dish rack myself because there is clearly a market.

title: Stove looks better!
text: They are not as tight fitting as the original pans, but they serve the purpose. Great value.

title: Five Stars
text: Good product, good service and good price.

title: Love this thing
text: This is the perfect egg holder. It takes up little to no space in the fridge and holds a good deal of eggs. Definitely worth the purchase.

title: Works As Stated, But The Family Is Always Knocking It Off (Not Item's Fault)
text:
My husband was always complaining about the musty smell in our front loader. I got this to remedy the problem.

HOW THIS COMES
This comes in a plastic box which has the item inside of it.

HOW IT WORKS
This sticks to the door of the washer and then the opening to hold it open. There are a few other areas you can stick magnets to make it work for your machine. Ours works fine- we have a Maytag original front loader washer.

DOES IT HELP?
When I asked my husband about this, he was not overly impressed. That is nothing new. He is not overly impressed with much of anything. However, he has noticed that there is not any musty smell anymore from the door getting shut as people walk by.

ANY DRAWBACKS?
The only issue I am having is that when people walk by and knock the door and if it happens to fall off, they don't put it back. That is not the fault of the item, but of careless family.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. This does what it says and our machine is definitely not as musty as it was before getting it.

title: Fits Philips 3221/44 Espresso Machine- So Far So Good
text:
We have a Philips Espresso machine that the entire family loves. It makes fantastic coffee of all sorts. Buying the filters can get expensive, especially when the unit is not being used for a period of time. I wanted to try this as an alternative.

IS IT THIS THE SAME?
This is just like the filter that comes from Philips for the 3221 machine. I think that the number is CA6903/10. It is not identical, but it is very close.

PERFORMANCE
So far this performs like the other filters, but the true test will be over a few months to see if we get the same long term performance. For now, it is good and fits well and seems to perform similar to the others we have from Philips.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This seems to fit and work like the filters from Philips. If this has the same long term performance, then we will switch to using these.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. So far that is my rating. If anything changes, I will update this review and rating to let you all know.

title: Perfect Compact Size, Makes Great Ice- One Warning
text:
We have had to buy our own ice for a while now. It was not too bad of a problem, but when things are closed around a lot, we began to wish we had an ice maker. Our refrigerator did not have the capacity for making ice and ice trays took up too much room and got tipped over too easily from careless kids. This, however, has changed all of that.

SIZE
The size of this unit is perfect if you want to have an ice maker but you don't have a lot of room. You will have to be sure to have clearance around it, however, as it won't fit in a tight space. It needs room for air to vent on the back and side.

PHOTO
In the photos I posted, I put a bottle of Pelligrino next to this unit so you can see how big it is. That is the larger Pelligrino glass bottle, not the small plastic ones.

ICE
The ice that is made from this can be smaller or larger. I picked the larger ones which also fit in most of our water bottles- a BIG plus. Smaller ones will fit in smaller bottle openings if you happen to have them.

WARNING
After reading through the instructions, I want to mention that you will want to probably use DISTILLED water for making ice in this. We have high lime content and in the past machines that recommend being cautious of lime build up even got build up that was hard to clean using our water FILTERED.

I have a few machines we have used distilled for and they have never had issues. We are using distilled with this as well.

DOES IT KEEP ICE COLD?
This keeps ice cold until you use it. It will make ice until it is full and then stop. Once it needs to be filled it will tell you that too.

QUIET?
This is very quiet compared to others I have heard.

IS IT FAST?
We got ice from this in about 7 minutes but it was only enough for one large glass. To get a larger load it took about an hour.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This is a fantastic little ice machine. The family is happy to have ice and not have to buy bagged ice and cram it in the storage freezer downstairs. As long as we use distilled water, I hope to not have any long range problems.

INSTRUCTIONS
Make sure to read instructions thoroughly as if you plan to not use this all of the time, you have to go through certain steps prior to storing it.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS so far. This is a big hit this summer. I am really happy to have this. It has made it so much easier to have our own ice when we want instead of realizing it is gone and have to go to the store when someone uses it up and says nothing.

title: Great For Use Off Grid With Hario Plastic Stand
text:
I like to get away into my she shed. This year has been a bit rough and I have wanted to go have a really nice pour over coffee in my shed using my wood stove. I got a goose neck pot with a temperature gauge for the wood stove, and now I wanted to have the metal filter for my plastic hario holder to pour over with.

HOW THIS IS MADE
This comes in a simple box. It has a rubber ring around the top and several layers of various sized of screening. Everything is well made and solid.

HOW DOES THIS PERFORM?
I use this with my plastic Hario holder over top of the Hario glass pot which has a woolen cover to keep it warm. I have to say that this is the best performing filter that I have used. It filters beautifully and has just the right speed of liquid passing through.

CLEANING
This is easy to clean. I knock the grounds out and rinse inside and out and it is ready to use again.

STORAGE
I can keep this in my Hario box with my holder and it fits perfectly.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This is a fantastic filter. It works so well and makes fabulous coffee. I am glad to have it to use in my off grid shed. It really makes me happy.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. This is great quality and I like it a lot. I highly recommend it if you have a Hario type of pour over set. It really does make great coffee - better than paper filters.

title: Perfect If You Don't Like The Water Speeding Through Your Aeropress
text:
I have had an Aeropress for some time now, and one of the reasons I stopped using it is because the hot water speeds through the Aeropress so fast no matter how fine I ground it that coffee was too weak. I even used a few different metal filters. This fixes that.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This is a combination of a cap that has a pressure sensitive silicone release valve set into the middle of a solid bottom and a metal fine screen. You screw it onto the Aeropress instead of the usual cover.

COMES WITH EXTRA VALVE
This even came with an extra valve in it so you can replace it if you need to in the future. I hope it won't be necessary for a long time though.

HOW DOES IT PERFORM?
When I first used this, I was not sure what to expect. I was able to put the right amount of coffee into the tube, put the right amount of water, and the BAM- it stayed put!

Once I waited long enough, I pressed the plunger and it was amazing- the coffee came out nice and strong- in fact PERFECT. Even my fussy daughter liked it.

THE ONLY PROBLEM
The only problem if you want to call it that is that you won't get those perfect little pucks of pressed coffee grounds to pop into the compost. It still comes out, but not as compacted. No big deal, just thought you might want to know.

THE BOTTOM LINE
A PERFECT addition to my Aeropress, this little beauty makes great coffee even better. It keeps the grounds in the water just long enough to make a truly good cup of coffee. I love how it works, and even don't mind losing the satisfaction of popping little pucks of coffee into the compost.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS for this ingenious invention. I really like this and the ability to not have to use paper filters. I love the metal filter and now with this addition, it is PERFECT and very economical too.

title: Glad This Came With TWO - Broke First One
text:
One of the places my family goes a lot has a Keurig. We don't generally like most of the prepacks of coffee, so we like to take our own. The problem is that some of the containers are rejected, so I wanted one that wouldn't be. Well, glad this came with two.

WHAT ARE THESE LIKE?
This comes with a black and a purple version. The cap opens up and you put the coffee in. You put it in the Keurig and use it, and then normal use would cause it to work. In my case.. *sighs*

WATCH WHAT YOU ARE DOING!
My daughter grabbed the one container I had with me and ran off to make her coffee. She had it in a bag, poured it in and then proceeded to slam the container into the unit, not realizing that you have to put it in ONE DIRECTION ONLY. IF YOU DON'T DO THAT IT WILL POKE A HOLE IN THE UNIT. That is precisely what happened to ours.

DOES THE OTHER ONE WORK?
The other one works as long as the person using it lines up the correct direction BEFORE trying to use it. IT seemed to perform well and the machine did not reject it. So, now I only have one, which is why I wanted two- they could ruin one and mine would stay intact.

CLEAN UP
Clean up is good . I used a tiny scrub brush gently to get the mesh clean.

THE BOTTOM LINE
As long as you use this properly it should work with the machine. If you don't it will poke a hole in it. The coffee works out well if you use it right.

MY RATING
FOUR STARS. I wish these had a more noticeable marking on it to keep this from being used incorrectly. But it is up to use to take our time to use it- as long as the family does not get a hold of it.

title: If You Have Just So Chickens With Standardized Eggs This Is Great
text:
I remember reading a story about a rather simple person who was making conversation with someone in a waiting room. She asked the man next to her what he did for a living and he responded , "I work in an egg factory".

"Oooohh what do you do there?" she asked.

"I put the shells on the eggs," he replied with a straight face.

"That is a respectable job," was her reply.

It is those type of eggs that this holder was made for, apparently. Let me explain..

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This box is great in theory. It has a firm construction to it. It is sturdy, and well made. It has a lid that fits tightly together, and it locks shut so that you can use it flat or stand it on its side. There is a slide on the top which goes from 1 to 30 so that you can mark how many days before you should replace your eggs, assuming you use them up within 30 days.

WHAT IS THE PROBLEM?
The problem with this is that hardly any eggs fit into it. The base where the bottom of the eggs sit is flexible somewhat, but the top is so shallow that it will not shut unless you have the perfectly small egg in it. It might fit medium if they are just so, but that is all. Most of our eggs will not fit in this. We use eggs from chickens at a local farm.

DOES IT WORK?
Once we culled out most of our eggs (thankfully we have quite a few) and found only those that fit in here, we were liking the ability to stand this case on its side for saving room in the refrigerator.

THE BOTTOM LINE
If you have eggs that are small or smaller than usual, this might work for you. If you have eggs from a farm that are more variable in size, move on to something else. It is great in theory, but not in practice.

MY RATING
This gets 3 out of five stars. It is just too fussy to have to cull through our eggs just to make some fit in here. I have found it useful to use the small ones for hard boiled eggs to store in here therefore making it more useful, but that is it. It is just not as useful as we would have hoped.

title: Nicer For Single Serving, Otherwise Not As Nice
text:
My family has a little coffee shop in our home. We love to make different styles and types of coffee with a variety of methods. We will do pour over, cold brew, and varieties of other styles of coffee which are not always mainstream. One thing that we love to do is make frothy milk (including non-dairy) to go with it. Let's see how this measures up.

WHAT IS THIS FROTHING JUG LIKE?
This is a HIGH quality jug. It is made from thick stainless steel. It has a wider bottom and narrower top to allow for frothing without splashing of smaller amounts of milk. The handle is not connected at the bottom, allowing for non-transfer of heat like handles which have the bottom attached.

CAN YOU HEAT UP MILK IN THIS?
Although you CAN heat up milk in this jug, it is not a thick bottom, so you have to be careful if you decide to try this.
If you have a very small burner and can warm it up slowly, it can be done. Do I recommend using it on a stove? I think it is too small unless you have a tiny burner available.

HOW MUCH DOES THIS HOLD?
Technically, this jug holds about a cup and a half of liquid. If you really want to froth milk, I would not go above 1/2 cup of milk.

COUNTRY OF ORIGIN?
Italy

HOW WELL DOES THIS WORK?
I have a frother which works best with more milk, but sometimes I just want a personal size of foamy milk. This is what this is good for. When using about 1/3 cup of milk, this will work fairly well. It is not quite as big allowing for as much air as my other frothers, but it does work.

DOES THIS WORK WITH THE NINJA INTELLIGENT COFFEE/TEA MACHINE?
This works nicely with the frother on the side of the Ninja coffee/tea machine. You have to hold it up, press the button, or put something under it to hold it high enough, but it works.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For a single or small dual serving of frothy milk, this jug is helpful. It works decently with a hand frother, Ninja frother, and small steamer/frothers if you have one of those. You can warm up with this on a small burner, but use caution as the bottom is not double thick. This is EXCELLENT quality stainless steel.

MY RATING
Four stars. I find that it takes longer to get a good foam in this jug than it does in a few other larger containers, but it still works. If the bottom section was a bit larger (more bulbous) it might work a bit better. This rating is more like FOUR AND A HALF stars, but I can only do whole stars, hence the four star rating. This is made from beautiful polished stainless.

title: Great To Take To Coffee Houses But Not My Favorite
text:
I am spoiled. I have had one of the nicest frothers ever. Cafe Casa. It is heavy duty and whips up milk like I have never seen any other hand frothers. I am still open to trying new ones, and this was a decent contender. Let's see how it works.

WHAT IS THIS FROTHER LIKE?
This frother has a cheap plastic base. It feels lightweight and cheap. It has a side switch on it and the whip is heavy duty compared to some that I have tried which are not as nice. There are two AA batteries required to run this and a very lightweight cover on the bottom is easily knocked out of place.

HOW DOES THIS PERFORM?
This frother works well. It does whip nicely but it has a bit of play in the way it spins. The handle is harder to hold and feels very cheap. I do not think it performs as nicely as the Cafe Casa that I have, but because I have to make my own coffee sometimes at some places (diet restrictions) I tend to like to have one I can bring with me when I go. This is a decent one for that if put in a box that will protect it.

ONE PROBLEM
One thing I do not like about this is the bottom. It is more rounded and not flat. That means that it rocks when I stand it upright and easily falls over.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For a less expensive frother that is lightweight and spins well, this is a decent choice. It has a few improvements that would make me like it better, but it is decent.

MY RATING
Three stars. This just is not as solid or nice as Cafe Casa is. It is better than some other frothers I have used anyway, so for that I give it the three- more like three and a half.

title: Pretty Good Despite Some Small Complaints.
text:
I received this washer today and ran it for the first time as soon as I unpacked it. It does what it's supposed to do. The agitation is powerful, surprisingly powerful. The spin dryer does an amazing job and is pretty quiet once the spinner gets going. I was not about to haul this thing atop some makeshift platform in order to make the gravity drain work, and I certainly wasn't going to carry pots of drain water to dump into the sink - I simply kept the drain hose in an upright position attaching it to the provided clip on the side of the washer and then slipped a smaller hose down inside the main drain hose - the other end of the smaller hose is attached to a small little pump I bought at my local home improvement store and drains into the kitchen sink. To drain the water I simply switched the washer to the 'Drain' setting and flipped the switch on the pump. Easy as pie. I did the same when running the spin dryer.
I do have a couple of complaints....
1. The washer arrived very, very dirty, especially the bottom - there was gross brown crud all over the bottom.
2. There was a number scratches and deep gouges on the outside.
3. The provided hose to fill is worthless - I simply attached a small hose used for normal full sized washing machines to my kitchen sink spigot and filled the washer that way - super easy and fast.

It definitely cannot handle adult sized bedding, and I have my doubts that it can handle even one pair of jeans - not because of power, because it's pretty powerful, but I say this due to it's size - it's crazy small inside. But it's great for very small loads....a couple of shirts, with some socks, undies, etc..

title: Replacing this wear item restored my dishwasher's performance after 10 ...
text: Replacing this wear item restored my dishwasher's performance after 10 years.  I should have done this perhaps 2 years ago.

title: solved problem with unresponsive buttons
text:
Buttons on my Jenn-Air Dishwasher became unresponsive so all I could do is start it. None of the options were accessible other than the 2 hour delay. I wondered if I needed to replace this button panel, or the circuit board it attaches to. I ordered this based on some internet research and the reviews indicating a solution to similar symptoms.

The item arrived and I quickly slipped the ribbon cable into the connector on the circuit board without removing the old panel. This test proved it would resolve the problem. I proceeded to replace the control panel in position. The only tools needed are a T-20 Torx driver, and a 1/4 hex-head capscrew driver (or 1/4 inch socket). Be sure to unplug the dishwasher since removing the circuit board cover exposes some 120V connectors that are not hard to short with a tool or your hand, hence the warning sticker on the cover.

I really have no complaints. The first panel lasted 10 years, which is somewhat fair considering how things are made relatively disposable these days. I didn't give it five stars only because I can't get too excited about a replacement part that doesn't upgrade anything.

title: overpriced
text:
This is a polyphosphate cartridge. Practically, it cannot "filter" the scale-causing minerals from the water, as there is far too much volume of minerals to hold in the tiny cartridge. Instead, the cartridge releases a small amount of polyphosphates into the water. Those chemicals inhibit the formation of the scale -- in simple terms, they keep the minerals suspended in the water and inhibit them from forming the white deposits. Of course, the minerals have to go somewhere, and they can't stay suspended indefinitely as they won't evaporate as steam. Some of the mineral material inevitably forms scale, while the rest is flushed out of the humidifier tank in the flush cycle (which is frequently problematic on the troublesome TrueSteam humidifiers). So the polyphosphates released by this cartridge help to inhibit scale by keeping the minerals suspended until they get flushed.

Now that you understand how it works, you can go get a standard 1/4" quick-connect, in-line polyphosphate scale-inhibiting filter that's twice the size for half the price. Either way, you can only expect it to last about 6 months. The polyphosphates used in these filters are "food grade" and considered acceptable for whole-house use, including drinking water (although there's no benefit for drinking). Polyphosphates are sometimes used in lieu of water softeners.

title: Works Great BUT READ ABOUT PARTS
text: OK - so I have a GE "Quietpower 3" or something like that dishwasher.  My wife and kids refuse to get all of the stuck on food off of the dishes before loading the dishwasher.  This causes the food to become mixed with the water, and get pumped through the pump and back through the spray arms.  Things like Rice and Stickers off of new cups and you name it clog up the arms, EXPECIALLY this center arm.  My dishwasher has a lower spinning arm on the bottom of the tub, this one attaches to the underside of the top rack, and then there is the top arm at the top of the dishwasher which is pretty useless.  I have taken the arms off at least 50 times and cleaned them by hand in the tub, soaking in vinegar, using pipe cleaners and wire to clear them out.  I finally gave up when something got caught inside that I couldn't dislodge.  THIS WORKED LIKE A CHARM.  However, here is something IMPORTANT FOR ALL TO READ.  When you take off the arm under the top rack - KEEP THE SCREW AND WASHER THAT COME OUT.  This arm does not have a new replacement screw or washer, and you'll need that to reinstall new arm.  This is not a defect or anything - It is just good information to have before you throw out the screw and washer and then have to go digging through the garbage to find it again, clean it and be able to put the new arm on.  Also - the part number from GE and the part number for this arm (and pretty much all other arms for dishwashers) do not match.  I simply eyeballed the picture and it looked identical and took a chance.  It is identical.  Works great.  Wife is happy.  I'll probably end up buying another to pre-plan for the next clog that occurs when my family decides to put a bowl full of rice into the dishwasher without rinsing it out first.

title: Fit my dishwasher...

The wheels on the front had fallen off, and I had to check multiple items to see if it would fit my dishwasher, as apparently some of the wheels for sale online are too wide. title: Worked and saved money!
text: My LG front loader with the control panel on top of the dryer, near the back - started making a huge racket.  It then would get stuck and to start it you would have to open the door and roll the drum around and try again.  I read online that these were the ones you needed.  NOTE:  These are only the wheels, not the posts or washers or little triangle plastic things that hold the rollers in place - and only ONE wheel per order, not two.  I bought four, and took my dryer apart.  I unplugged the unit, popped the top open from the front - there are two latches you have to open with a putty knife near each side.  Then I just took off the screws on top, took the screws off the door panel (Kept the door on), then popped and lifted the front door panel off.  Then unscrewed 2 screws to take the metal thingy off where the air goes after it goes through your lint filter in the door, then 4 screws to take the front of the drum holder off.  Then you reach under the drum, hold back the pulley tension wheel and the belt comes loose.  You use the belt to lift the drum out.  There are two rollers in back and two on the inside of the front panel that you took off.  I kept the posts as they were fine.  One of the plastic holding clips was missing, and one wheel had broken the inside hole wide open.  You carefully pull the plastic triangle holding clip off (they break sometimes) - if you break them, I used what I believe was called a 9/16 "E" clip you can get at any hardware store.  They also sell this wheel in a version on Amazon that comes with the posts and clips completely.  I only replaced the front two rollers, as the ones in back were fine.  I cleaned the dryer out with a vaccum and then reassembled it all.  Took about 2 hours including a trip to the hardware store.  One guy online said to use a 1/2 inch "E" clip, but it didn't look like it was big enough.  I could get the 1/2 on, but the 9/16ths seemed to fit better.  I ordered 4 of these, but only used two.  No worries, I have two backups now and I fixed my dryer for under $50 instead of buying a new $800 dryer.  Thanks!  Worked great.  These were pictured blue when I bought them - the ones inside the dryer are blue - these were delivered gray, but they fit perfectly.  Dryer runs quiet again!  No more THUMP THUMP THUMP!

title: Go ahead, do it, buy this part and fix your washer, because it's that easy.
text:
Part Trader - Fast Shipping (FEDEX!!) and easy purchase of course. The part fit and now my washer sounds better than new.

The part - The rotor assembly appears to be redesigned. The original part, looking at the "gear" or teeth, was both white plastic and some kind of black material. It was stripped out, so the rotor would spin without the tub. It took over 5 years for this to happen. As such, I even ran out of our extended warrantee. (Good Job LG - Sarcasm) It would appear this is meant to happen and is a sacrificial part of the rotor, for two reasons. 1) To prevent motor burnout I guess. The motor has a 10 year warrantee. 2) To make a few extra bucks. Sure they could sell a piece of plastic, but no they have to include the magnets and half of what makes up a motor. I digress. The new part, made, May 5th 2015, is "brand new" The entire gear teeth is made out of this black material, about an 1/8th inch all around. Significantly more than what was on the original component. Therefore I hope this is a permanent fix.

Conclusion - LG offered a 10 year warranty on the direct drive motor. However In all my motor experience, the rotor should be included in this warranty. Regardless, the cost of the part, and ease of repair, it is still cheaper than messing with the warranty. According to our repair guy, over the phone, he suggested the cost would be around $140 for the repair, which included an $80 diagnostic, applied to the final bill - if under warranty. Fair is fair, he needs a job, but not while I can do it. I feel duped, from the standpoint that LG engineered the washer this way. If they sold the plastic part for $6, by itself, I would sing praises to them. But, no, they didn't do it. The MSRP of the part is $100, and we are getting it for little more than half that. Which means the repair guy should charge about $300 for parts and labor.

It's not a $300 job, if you ask me. It's easier than changing a tire.

text: I purchased this model in black from HD two years ago. I loved the spaciousness, bright interior lighting, the deli drawer! and the bottom freezer. That is, until things starting malfunctioning and breaking down. The ice maker kept spilling over, the fill bar popping out, and ice jamming the drawer. Then the ice maker started spraying water inside the freezer which again froze over some food and jammed the door. We fixed it, but more problems came. The ice seemed to be shrinking and taking a long time to make. Frost seemed to be coming and going, the ice cream was either soft of crystallized. And then we discovered water leaking out from under the fridge which damaged our kitchen floor. I called LG and got the number for an authorized service tech who came out and told the sealed system was leaking and would need to be replaced. The good news, the sealed system (compressor, evaporator and condenser) were still under warranty. The bad news, it was still going to end up costing me $700 to repair the fridge. An internet search turned up hundreds of customer complaints about this and other LG fridges, same problems as I've had, plus interior light sets causing the plastic interior to melt and sometimes catch on FIRE. Most reports were that LG refused to take care of the problems. I loved this fridge, but I can't afford to keep a $1400 box that doesn't keep my food at a safe temperature.

title: Manufacturer's part is just what was needed for sticking handle
text:
I purchased this dishwasher part directly from Amazon, not one of the third party vendors who offer it for a lower price. What I received is a genuine Whirlpool part in a sealed plastic bag that says it was made in the US. The part has a different number and a sticker that says it was made in Mexico. None of this matters to me because the part is correct, intact and it is a perfect fit for my Maytag Quiet Series 200 dishwasher.

If you are repairing your dishwasher latch and handle assembly, be sure this is the correct part. My original was white, but it's now only manufactured with a black handle. Assure that the power is cut to your dishwasher to avoid electrocution. Have your torx t20 bit in a driver or screwdriver because you need it to remove the 11 screws holding the interior door to the exterior door. The two screws at the center of the upper edge hold this piece in place, so they should be the last two you remove and the first two you secure upon completion. The entire process from start to finish took about 10 minutes, including the time it took to identify the circuit to cut.

title: Problem free, made in the USA
text: Three refillable K-Cups in a package is perfect because I now have one dedicated to coffee, a second for tea, and a third for a spare.  These by EcoGreen Savings are a nice color, easy to find in a crowded space, and they are sturdy enough to withstand regular use.  I empty the grounds directly into the kitchen compost pot and nothing is wasted.  Very easy to clean, I use a little brush to get out each particle by had and let the plastic air dry.  The seal is good, too.  There has been no problem with either Keurig machine I have tried in brewing cup after cup with these.  Sample was supplied for evaluation.

title: Chemex filters are necessary for the best coffee in a Chemex pot
text: I've been brewing coffee for decades in a Chemex coffee pot.  I also use an assortment of other coffee makers, stove top, table top and electric.  When my supply of the Chemex Bonded Unbleached Pre-folded Square Coffee Filters was depleting, I purchased a reusable hemp filter, thinking that a difference would not be noticeable.  I was so wrong. These bonded paper filters, when moistened with water before filling with freshly ground coffee, produce a coffee that displays the coffee essence without residual solids or added bitterness from the fabric or paper.  The folded square design allows the user to simply pull one free corner to turn a square into a cone that allows for perfect filtering of the hot water as it's gently poured into the coffee carafe.  By slowly adding the water, you can control the drip and my preference is to pour around the outer edge instead of directly into the center of the filter.  In all these years, I have never had a Chemex filter break or slip through and into the carafe, as I've had occur with the hemp filter.  I also like the Chemex round filters and have just ordered a package, so I'll review those once I recall how they compare for me.  I purchased a case of these pre-folded squares some time ago, so I don't remember my impression of the other filters.  If you care about the taste of your coffee, then I absolutely recommend using these with your Chemex.

title: Easy install if you know how
text: The [[ASIN:B002ROS27U Whynter UIM-155 Stainless Steel Built-In Ice Maker]] didn't come with instructions for installation, so be sure you have someone who knows what they're doing before you turn off your water.  Once it's installed, this is easy to operate and performs as required, freezing water and extruding little crescent shaped cups of ice into a plastic bucket which is included.  Also included is the plastic water hose and a plastic scooper, all are white.  The ice maker is black with a stainless steel front door and it's interior is white.  The on/off switch as at the bottom of the appliance and it's very easy to depress.  If you need an ice maker and are prepared to defrost this every four to six weeks, it seems to be a good product.  I wasn't impressed with the thin door seal or amount of ice contained in the tray, but it's acceptable.  There is a warning in the literature that this appliance can be loud and I would have to agree.  It's quieter if your ice tray is full because the machine stops producing ice.  You can also stop it as desired by simply lifting the wire until you're ready to make more.  This ice maker is about the size of a dorm refrigerator and it's a great option for a basement bar type situation or health care need.

title: When done, throw into the compost pile
text: The Melitta Tea Filters, 40-Count (Pack of 6) is a wonderful way to create tea bags, spice bags, bath salt bags, or whatever you can think of for a secure and economical system.  I generally place loose tea leaves with herbs and spices inside an unbleached bag, then put it into a teapot.  After adding hot water and waiting for the prescribed time period, I easily remove the bag and have a pot of tea with a minimal amount of residue in the brew.  Because a filled bag will remain open, I've also created some gifts by attaching a cotton string and little hand decorated tag to the bags.  For the unsealed bag, be careful that the longer end does not hang over the edge of a cup, mug or teapot too much or you'll run the risk of the hot water being absorbed all the way to the upper edge, saturating it and possibly dripping onto the table top.  This happened to me once because I forgot to retrieve the bag and the teapot sat for about a half hour.  The bags can also be used for mulling spices because they are rather large.  I love them!

title: Well constructed and shapely large vessel

title: Just what I needed
text:
I have a Kenmore dryer that is about 10 years old made by LG. Two years ago it really needed repair. When I took it apart, one of the rollers had been completely worn down. I bought the parts contained in this kit separately, and paid a lot more than this kit.

Two years later, the dryer was making noise. I decided to take it apart and check it out. This kit is so cheap, I figured if I was going to do the work, I may as well have what I need to fix it. I found that even after two years there was a dangerous amount of hair and dust in the dryer. That alone made it worthwhile to take apart the dryer.

The two front rollers had lots of hair and didn't roll easily. The back ones were OK, but still had some hair and were not totally easy to roll. But to my surprise the idler pulley did not roll well. I should have left the original as the replacement I guess was crap.

It takes about an hour for me to take apart the dryer and replace these parts. Now that I have done it a couple times I am more familiar with the job. Thank God for You Tube because they will explain how to do it.

BOTTOM LINE: It is best to take apart your dryer and clean it out every couple years. (What I saw today looked like it could easily start a fire.) Once you get in there, you are likely to find problems with rollers or possibly the idler pulley, especially if your dryer is making noise. If you have a part that it totally working perfectly, don't replace it especially if it originally came with your dryer. Aftermarket parts can be low quality like the idler pulley that I bought last time.

title: Just what I was looking for.
text:
I initially ordered their long handled tea infusers and while they worked, they weren't exactly what i needed. I make hot tea with fresh mint leaves, fresh grated ginger, fennel seeds, etc. I wanted something that kept my ingredients out of my drinking tea but infused them with the flavor. I also wanted something that was easy to clean. These fit the bill perfectly! The company actually reached out to me and recommend I try these since I didn't completely love their other product. How awesome is that? It's nice to know that The Friendly Swede cares about their customers and want you to be happy with their products and provide personalized recommendations.

These mesh tea infusers are easy to use and seal up well with the ingredients. They have a small clasp on the side that slides in and closes the two halves together. This also makes it easy to clean since the entire thing opens up when you are done and I never have to worry about grated ginger or small fennel seeds getting stuck in there. These also have a hook at the end so you can place it on the tip of your cup so when you are ready to remove the infuser, you don't have to dig it out. Simply unhook it from your cup and remove it.

I am so happy with these and have been using them daily since I received them. That in addition to the follow-up from the company have made me a happy customer. I wouldn't hesitate to buy these again or other products from them.

It functioned just like the Trangia but in a slow constant flame and the flame lasted almost half an hour because i filled this stove with yellow HEET fuel up to the brim. It actually cooked 4 pieces of thick bacon, a big whole piece of Polish sausage, fried 3 scrambled eggs to a slight burn and on top of this it also boiled a liter of water to a full rolling boil! all this cooking in a half hour and one single fill of fuel! i don't know if i'm ever going back in sing a trangia mini burner again knowing that this stove is actually more fuel efficient and burns even and constant....i think i'll stick to this stove for the time being and I might order another in the near future.

title: Compact, portable, and easy to use ice maker.
text:
[[VIDEOID:1b1b9e0883a865bc6e2a22a029b6fd31]] This is a great compact, portable, and affordable ice maker. Originally purchased this because the built-in ice maker in the fridge at home stopped working and we don't have much room in the freezer for ice trays. It would've cost way too much to repair the fridge's ice maker, so we shopped around and purchased this Silonn countertop ice maker machine. This brand has two sizes. We purchased the 12 x 9 x 12 inch model. My family and I have been using this machine for over a week and so far it has exceeded our expectations. It doesn't make much noise while operating and the main noise comes from when a new batch of ice is complete and dropped in the tray. The ice cubes made are bullet shaped and you can choose between large and small size ice cubes. It takes approximately 8 minutes for a set of 9 ice cubes to be made. I poured a little over 32 fl. oz. of water into the water reservoir and it looks like it can fit another 8 fl. oz. or so before it reaches the max fill line. In my initial test the machine filled the ice tray with ice and had about 16 fl oz. of water left in the reservoir. The user manual states the water reservoir capacity is 1.5L

Pros of this machine:
- portable
- compact
- its easy to use.
- the power cord is long.
- comes with an ice tray/basket, ice scoop, power cable, drain plug.
- can make 2 different sizes of bullet shaped ice cubes.
- minimal noise while operating.
- has a drain plug to easily drain the excesss water left in the water reservoir of the machine.
- has a transparent lid, which makes it easy to view how much ice is inside the tray/basket.
- has a "self cleaning" feature. When the self cleaning mode is activated the pump will start to pump water and keep running for 15 minutes. After 15 minutes the machine will go back to standby mode and you'll need to manually open the drain plug to remove the water.
- has physical buttons at the top of the machine to quickly change settings.
- has a sensor that alerts you if the machine needs more water to make ice. There is an indicator at the top of the machine will lights up if this happens.
- has a sensor that alerts you if the ice tray/basket is full and temporarily stops making ice. When there is room again the machine automatically starts making ice. here is an indicator at the top of the machine wil light up if this happens.

Cons of this machine:
- the handle feels flimsy and is made of plastic. I don't trust carrying the machine by just holding the handle. It really feels like it cannot hold the 15 lb machine for very long.

This ice maker machine supposedly makes 27 lbs of ice per 24 hours, which is way more than I'll ever need. It also states in the product page that with each product sold they donte to water.org Although it doesn't states how much they donate to them with each product sold, but still a nice gesture.

I've included a short video of the machine in action when it is the noisiest and photos of the machine itself. There is a photo with me holding the ice scoop, which has two ice cubes in the scoop to compare the large size ice cube (on the left side of the photo) vs the small size ice cube (on the right side of the photo). Hope this review helps my fellow Amazon shoppers.

Note that almost all grocery stores sell the #2 cone filter you need for this product under their store brand and in bulk, making it even less expensive to use. You can also find reusable mesh #2 cone filters if you prefer.

Great for camping/hiking as it's so lightweight (assuming you have a vessel in which to boil water with you already, which I would hope you would!).

text:
I got these as an experiment to replace my MyCaps brand filters for the Nespresso refills. They are slightly smaller, but that doesn't impact function at all. The filter material is thicker and compared to the other ones it is barely transparent. This adds a little pressure to the machine when brewing and I have found that grinding the coffee one setting coarser makes up for that. Overall, they work and are a fraction of the price. I will continue to use these and save a little money since I do drink a fair amount of coffee.

title: Coffee grinds everywhere
text: This isn't my first attempt at using a foil-based pod reloading kit but will be my last. Not for the reasons most people would think. This kit is okay for holding a pod and filling it, but the issue comes from the foil lid. I have tried many brands and this one is no different. The adhesives all fail when they get hot, and the grinds leak out. This is one of the worse ones I have tested, leaking around the entire seal. The stand itself is a little undersized too. The pods don't sit flush and when you push down to seal the foil, you can feel the pod flexing in. It doesn't damage the pod, but just seems poorly sized. Overall, I cannot recommend this product.

I said all I wanted was a cap (50Cents) that should  have come with the dishwsher, 3 months old and under warrantee. The "Customer Support person" said he was sorry but I had to spend $40.00 and buy the entire assembly. Well, you know I blew a fuse by this time and said a few things I cannot repeat.Went out on the net and had to pay $17.00 for a cap plus $7.50 Fed EX shipping. Only in America!!! I think I will tie a chain around this new one.

title: Indistinguishable from Chemex filters.
text:
Likes.
Same as the Chemex filter.

Cons.
You need to fold them.

When you receive the package and open it, you gasp. You think, “these are gigantic.”. Rest easy. They are the same size as the Chemex. On one side, there was a 1/2 inch difference. However, unlike Chemex filters, which are pre folded and come in a square box, These are not folded, and come in a large flat box. They take about 5 seconds to fold before using them.

After I compared these, side by side, with the Chemex filters, and then folded the folder, I couldn't tell which was the Chemex and which was this filter.,

I think the decision to buy these, as opposed to the Chemex brand, is based on: 1. Price difference at the time. 2. Availability. 3. Your storage preference. For me, these would be easier to store than the Chemex square boxes. I snagged six boxes of Chemex during the shortage, and the square boxes do take up a lot of space.

title: Filter is an excellent value.  Shut your water off before changing the filter.
text:
Both the Samsung Instructions, and the instructions that came with this filter say to shut the water supply off. I never did that with any other refrigerators, so I ignored the instruction.

Without shutting the water off, I found that removing the original filter on my new Samsung was impossible. It just wouldn't twist. I then shut the water off. Once I shut off the the main house water supply to the house, the original filter was easy to twist off, and this filter was easy to install. I found it easier to turn the water off to the whole house, than to move my refrigerator.

With the water off, the original filter was easy to twist off.
There was no water spill when I removed it.
This new filter went on easily.

I ran a little over a gallon off, to clear the water.

My setup.

A Samsung 4 door flex, 23 counter depth refrigerator.
Original filter appears to read DA 20-0002084. Print is very small. I may be off.

I noticed my coffee stopped tasting as good. There was something wrong.

It gets moderate daily use. Somewhere around 15-20 cups a day so its never just sitting.

title: Saves Money In the Long Run
text:
If you are looking to invest in a great ice maker this is an excellent option. This portable ice maker is about the size of my breadmaker and sits easily on the end of my kitchen counter. You have to make sure the air outlet is 8-10 inches away from the nearest wall or object. This is easy to do if you place this on the end of a counter.

What I like about this particular ice maker is that you can watch the entire process of ice making through a see-through window. What happens is the ice is made in a little tray. The water is put under the ice basket and is sucked up into the ice tray. The ice forms around metal and is then released into the ice basket with a little mechanical shovel.

To fill up the ice basket it takes 77 minutes so one hour and seventeen minutes later you have three large glasses of ice. Once you empty the basket it will then continue to create ice for another fifty six minutes. So to make a gallon bag of ice takes 133 minutes and uses up a little less than two quarts of water. This is actually a lot faster than most freezers produce ice.

I personally like the large sized ice but there is an option for smaller ice too. I noticed that the ice this initially makes tends to be smaller than the ice made a little later. So each time the water is colder and produces bigger ice cubes (well they really look like little hollow thimbles).

Setup is easy once you've read the directions. You simply fill with water and push the start button. Then each batch of ice takes about seven minutes to make. You can use tap water, filtered water or bottled water. Whatever you prefer. The taste of the ice will change with each option. I made some ice with tap water and it tasted OK in a drink.

What you don't want to do is use this to make ice ahead of time. If you put the slightly wet ice cubes in the freezer they do tend to freeze together. It is best to use this as a source of ice that you are going to use on a consistent basis like at a small party where ice is needed for an extended period of time. Remember you are going to get about three large glasses of ice per hour. You can however remove ice for smaller glasses at any time. The hinged lid opens easily and does not restrict taking ice out even if the ice maker is in operation. I would however recommend caution as this does have moving parts. You want to keep your hands only on the ice scoop and take ice directly out of the basket.

So my only real caution would be that this ice maker should be kept away from children. It is not a toy! Even if it feels like it is.

One thing the directions don't state is what to do with the leftover water in the ice tray once the low water indicator comes on. I simply tilted the entire ice maker so the water ran down into the water container. Then I drained out the water leftover by removing the plug while sitting the ice maker over the sink. It was pretty easy. If you were making ice for a party then you would have to refill the water quite a few times over a period of hours. You have to refill the water approximately every 133 minutes. The ice maker will stop once the basket is full. The minute you remove the ice it starts making it again. You could keep extra ice in an ice bucket.

I found this ice maker great fun to use and I loved the shapes of the ice. I made myself some ice tea with the first batch of ice and it was great. I can see myself using this a lot in the summer although this ice maker is not for outside use. You should also keep it out of direct sunlight as that will cause the infared sensor to malfunction. Also this does make a little sound mostly like a fan running. It is fairly quiet. The loudest noise you will hear is when the ice drops and is put into the basket.

~The Rebecca Review

I received one ice maker free for review. This review is my honest opinion.

title: Perfect for small apartments
text: I was concerned about the noise level or making a lot of noise that it would bother my neighbor and I must say it's super quiet! Except when the load is out of balance in the spin basket. I can barely hear the machine when I'm in the next room. I'm super careful with what I use in this machine since it's mostly plastic. Instead of bleach (corrosive to plastic) I use baking soda and vinegar instead. My laundry smells beautiful and it's clean. The machine does so well at spinning out all excess water that my clothes are almost dry when they come out.  No Assembly needed and it's super easy to use. I've washed towels jeans size 14 and even a light weight cotton blanket twin size and each one with ease! The spin basket works better than the regular commercial washer offered by my apartment complex. Also the towels I wash are not bath sheets. So I'm careful to not overload the machine. I give this 4 stars so far for ease of use and convenience, size, and low noise level. It seems like it's made well. It is mostly plastic but I think that is a  good thing because it's light and easy to move, and it won't rust. I'm hoping this will last for awhile.

title: Exactly what I expected
text:
My Kenmore refrigerator had been having problems with not activating cooling consistently. I determined it to be thermostat based on how cooling wouldn't start, but I could make it run by giving my fridge a whack right by the temp controls. I found the part and instructions on how to replace it on the sears parts direct site. Not wanting to pay almost $80 for the part if I didn't need to, I searched for the part number listed on Amazon and found this item for under $15 - that is a hefty price difference and since the reviews were generally good, I went ahead and purchased it. It got to me in under 2 days and took about 15 minutes to install.

I will say the insulating sleeve on it seems to be a little cheap (not even sure it is intended to be for insulating). I tried to swap it for the original one, but the end of the sensor is a little thicker then the original insulating sleeve will allow. I assume this will mean that I need to set my fridge to be a little colder than I had before.

Very happy with this replacement part for the price.

Only time will tell how well this is manufactured, but at the price, getting 2 years use out of it will make it more than worth it considering that my fridge is only 9 years old.

title: Love this dryer!
text:
This dryer is awesome! I got a great deal on it when I bought it along with the matching washer. This dryer works awesome and gets my clothes dry quickly. It runs quietly and plays a song at the end of the dry cycle instead of the usual annoying buzz!

One thing to know about this dryer is that I usually have to set the automatic dry to "more dry" instead of "normal." The normal setting has almost always ended up with clothes that are still a little damp. It is a minor annoyance and something I don't even think about now.

This dryer looks confusing at first with so many buttons and the dial as well as a display, but you will quickly find that the controls are easy to figure out and make lots of sense! You will be efficiently drying your clothes in no time!

text: Pump was an exact match to my Kenmore HE5t steam washer.  Installation is simple.  Just remove lower panel below door with three screws.  Pump is held in place by only two screws through bottom of washer,  two water hose clamps, and the electrical connection.  Be sure to unplug washer first!  My washer is on a pedestal which required me to remove the 4 screws holding them together.  I then gently slid the washer forward off the pedestal just far enough to access the two screws for the pump on the bottom of the machine.  My pump was trashed by a thumbtack.  Be sure to clean the strainer out on this pump occasionally.  It wasn't obvious to me and it cost me.
